124.Musharraf Hussain: Anyone who turns away from My remembrance will live a difficult life and We shall raise him up blind on Judgement Day.

125.Musharraf Hussain: He will say, “My Lord, why did you raise me up blind, I was sighted in the world?”

126.Musharraf Hussain: He will say, “That’s because Our signs came to you and you forgot them; likewise, you are forgotten today.”

127.Musharraf Hussain: This is how We deal with those who wasted the opportunity, and didn’t believe in their Lord’s signs. The punishment of the Hereafter is more severe and everlasting.

128.Musharraf Hussain: The fact that We destroyed many generations before them, whose houses they used to walk around, should be a source of guidance for them; in this are signs for the understanding.

129.Musharraf Hussain: If it wasn’t for the previous verdict from your Lord, the inevitable would have happened. But there is a fixed time for it

130.Musharraf Hussain: So be patient with what they say, and glorify your Lord with praise before sunrise and sunset, and during the night, and at the ends of the day, so you may be happy.

131.Musharraf Hussain: Don’t look with envy at what We gave them to enjoy from life’s worldly luxuries; it’s Our way of testing them, and your Lord’s sustenance is better and everlasting.

132.Musharraf Hussain: Teach your family to pray and perform it yourself as well. We don’t ask you for provision, actually, We provide for you, and a good outcome is a result of righteousness

133.Musharraf Hussain: They said, “Why didn’t he bring a book from His Lord? Hasn’t a clear sign already come to them in former books of revelation?”

134.Musharraf Hussain: Had We destroyed them with a punishment before this they would say, “Our Lord, why did you not send a messenger to us? We would have followed your revelation, so we wouldn’t be disgraced and put to shame.”

135.Musharraf Hussain: Say: “Each one of us is waiting, so you wait as well; soon you will know those who were on the straight path and rightly guided.”<basmala>In the name of Allah, the Kind, the Caring

1.Musharraf Hussain: The time of reckoning for humanity is drawing closer, yet they turn away thoughtlessly.

2.Musharraf Hussain: Whenever a new revelation from your Lord comes to them they listen to it playfully,

3.Musharraf Hussain: their hearts distracted by worldly activities. In private the evildoers say, “Isn’t he just a man like you? Are you going to follow the magic of Muhammad with your eyes open?”

4.Musharraf Hussain: The Prophet said, “My Lord knows every word spoken in the Heavens and the Earth; He is the Listener, the Knower.”

5.Musharraf Hussain: They replied, “These are just confused dreams; he’s made them up. In fact, he’s a poet, so let him bring us a miracle like the prophets of the past brought.

6.Musharraf Hussain: The communities We destroyed before them didn’t believe either, so will they now believe?

7.Musharraf Hussain: We sent Revelation to communities in the past; if you don’t know this ask the people of the Scripture.

8.Musharraf Hussain: We didn’t make their bodies to live on Earth forever, nor could they survive without food.

9.Musharraf Hussain: We fulfilled Our promise and saved those who We wanted, and destroyed those who wasted the opportunity of life.

10.Musharraf Hussain: Indeed We revealed a Book to you that mentions you too! Why do you not understand

11.Musharraf Hussain: We destroyed many towns of the sinners, and afterwards raised up other people in their place.

12.Musharraf Hussain: When they sensed our punishment coming they fled,

13.Musharraf Hussain: and We said: “Do not run away; come back to the places of your enjoyment and homes so you may be questioned.”

14.Musharraf Hussain: They said, “Suffering has come upon us; we were evildoers.”

15.Musharraf Hussain: They screamed till We made them like dried up stubble.

16.Musharraf Hussain: We didn’t create the Heavens and the Earth and what is between the two as a sport.

17.Musharraf Hussain: If We wanted a pastime then We would have found it within Us, were We to do such a frivolous thing.

18.Musharraf Hussain: Nay, We pitched the truth against falsehood, so it wiped it out; falsehood is weak. For you is Hell for the things you attributed to Allah.

19.Musharraf Hussain: Everything in the Heavens and the Earth belongs to Him; those near Him are not arrogant about worshipping Him, nor do they get tired.

20.Musharraf Hussain: They are always glorifying Him, night and day, never growing weary.

21.Musharraf Hussain: Or have they taken gods from the Earth who can resurrect

22.Musharraf Hussain: If there were gods other than Allah, then there would be devastation in the Heavens and the Earth. Glory to Allah, Lord of the Throne, He isn’t the way they describe Him.

23.Musharraf Hussain: He won’t be questioned about what He does, but they’ll be questioned!

24.Musharraf Hussain: Or have they taken gods besides Him? Say: “Bring your proof; this is a reminder for those who are with me and a reminder for those before me,” but most of them don’t know the truth, they have turned away.

25.Musharraf Hussain: Every messenger before you was inspired to say: “There is no god but Me, so worship Me.”

26.Musharraf Hussain: They said, “The Kind Lord has a child.” Glory to Him, they are honourable servants

27.Musharraf Hussain: who don’t speak before He speaks and obey His command.

28.Musharraf Hussain: Allah knows what is in front and behind them, and they will not intercede except for him who He is pleased with, since they are in fear of Him.

29.Musharraf Hussain: If any among them claimed, “I am god beside Him,” then We shall punish him in Hell; that’s how We treat the evildoers

30.Musharraf Hussain: Don’t the disbelievers know the Heavens and the Earth were joined at one time? We split them apart and made every living thing from water; won’t they believe?

31.Musharraf Hussain: We made mountains on Earth for stability, so it does not shake beneath them, and We made wide, open pathways so they can find their way.

32.Musharraf Hussain: And We made the sky a roof that gives protection, they still turn away from these marvellous signs.

33.Musharraf Hussain: He created night and day, sun and moon, each one moving in its orbit.

34.Musharraf Hussain: In the past We didn’t make any human being who lived forever, so if you should die, will they live forever?

35.Musharraf Hussain: Everyone will taste death; We shall test you all with something good and something bad, and finally you will be returned to Us

36.Musharraf Hussain: The disbelievers mock when they see you and say, “Is this the one who talks about your gods?” They fail to acknowledge the name of the most Kind Lord.

37.Musharraf Hussain: Man was made hasty and impatient; I will show you My signs, so don’t ask Me to hasten them.

38.Musharraf Hussain: They ask, “When will this promise be fulfilled if you are truthful?”

39.Musharraf Hussain: If only the disbelievers knew, a time will come when they won’t be able to stop the Fire burning their faces and backs, and they will be helpless.

40.Musharraf Hussain: It will come unexpectedly, taking them by surprise, they won’t be able to get away, nor get any relief.

41.Musharraf Hussain: Messengers were mocked before you, and the jokers were punished by the punishment they use to mock

42.Musharraf Hussain: Say: “Who can protect you at night and during the day from the Most Kind Lord?” They turn away from their Lord’s remembrance.

43.Musharraf Hussain: Or do they have gods that can protect them beside Us? They’re incapable of helping themselves, or being safe from Us.

44.Musharraf Hussain: For a long time, We allowed them and their fathers to enjoy the good things of life. Haven’t they noticed how We are gradually reducing the borders of their city? So, are they dominant?

45.Musharraf Hussain: Say: “I am warning you with the revelation.” Unfortunately, the deaf will not hear the warning call when it’s given.

46.Musharraf Hussain: If a mere puff of your Lord’s punishment strikes them they say, “It’s too bad for us; we were wrong.

47.Musharraf Hussain: On Judgement Day, We shall set up the scales of justice so that no one is misjudged. Even if there is something as little as the weight of a mustard seed, We shall bring it out; We are good in weighing

48.Musharraf Hussain: We gave Musa and Harun the standard to distinguish between right and wrong, a light and a message for the mindful people –

49.Musharraf Hussain: those who fear their Lord without seeing Him, and they are fearful of the Final Hour.

50.Musharraf Hussain: This is a sacred message We have sent down, so will you reject it

51.Musharraf Hussain: Long before that We gave Ibrahim guidance; We knew him well.

52.Musharraf Hussain: Remember when He said to his father and the community: “What are these idols you worship?”

53.Musharraf Hussain: They said, “Our forefathers were their worshippers.”

54.Musharraf Hussain: He said, “You and your forefathers are obviously wrong.”

55.Musharraf Hussain: They replied, “Have you come with the truth or are you joking?”

56.Musharraf Hussain: He said, “Your Lord is the Lord of the Heavens and the Earth Who created them, and I am one of the witnesses to this.

57.Musharraf Hussain: By Allah, I will plan something for your idols after you have turned your backs and gone away.

58.Musharraf Hussain: He smashed them to pieces except the biggest, which He left intact so they would return to it.

59.Musharraf Hussain: They said, “Who has done this to our gods? He must be evil!”

60.Musharraf Hussain: Some said, “We heard a young man called Ibrahim speak disapprovingly about them.

61.Musharraf Hussain: So they demanded: “Bring him in front of the people, so they will see him.”

62.Musharraf Hussain: They asked, “Ibrahim, did you do this to our gods?

63.Musharraf Hussain: He replied, “It was the big one who did this; ask them if they can speak.”

64.Musharraf Hussain: So they turned to themselves saying secretly, “You are the ones who are wrong.”

65.Musharraf Hussain: They shook their heads in disbelief and said, “You know they can’t speak.”

66.Musharraf Hussain: Ibrahim quipped, “So, why do you worship beside Allah something unable to benefit or harm you?

67.Musharraf Hussain: A disgrace for you and what you worship beside Allah; why don’t you understand?”

68.Musharraf Hussain: They shouted angrily: “Burn him and help your gods if you are going to do something.”

69.Musharraf Hussain: We ordered: “Fire, be cool and comforting for Ibrahim.”

70.Musharraf Hussain: They wished to harm him, so We made them the biggest losers

71.Musharraf Hussain: We rescued Ibrahim and Lut, and took them to the land We blessed for all humanity.

72.Musharraf Hussain: So We gave Ibrahim, Ishaq, and Yaqub as a grandson, and We made them righteous

73.Musharraf Hussain: and great leaders, guiding others with Our commandments, and inspired many virtues: the performance of the prayer, and the giving of Zakat. They were Our true worshippers.

74.Musharraf Hussain: We gave Lut authority and knowledge, and rescued him from a town which practised filthy acts of indecency; they were sinful people.

75.Musharraf Hussain: We were kind to Lut since he was righteous

76.Musharraf Hussain: Remember the bygone days when Nuh called for help. We answered, and rescued him and his followers from a terrible torment.

77.Musharraf Hussain: We helped him against people who denied Our revelations. They were evil; so We drowned them.

78.Musharraf Hussain: Remember when Dawud and Sulayman were making judgement regarding the cornfield where some people’s sheep had wandered off to graze. We were Witness of their judgement.

79.Musharraf Hussain: We helped Sulayman understand the problem. Each one We blessed with judgment and knowledge. We made mountains echo and the birds sing our praises together with Dawud; We did all these things.

80.Musharraf Hussain: We taught him how to make coats of armour, so that you can protect yourself from others. Will you be thankful for this?

81.Musharraf Hussain: Sulayman could command the stormy winds blowing to the land which We had blessed. We know all things.

82.Musharraf Hussain: He also controlled the jinn that dived deep in the sea for him, and would do other work for him too. We were their keepers.

83.Musharraf Hussain: And remember Ayyub when He called his Lord: “I am suffering. You are the Kindest of all.”

84.Musharraf Hussain: We answered and relieved him of the sufferings, gave back his family, even bigger than before. For the worshippers, this was a special kindness from Us and a reminder.

85.Musharraf Hussain: Ismael, Idrees and Zul-Kifl – each one was patient and steadfast.

86.Musharraf Hussain: We blessed them with prophethood. They were righteous

87.Musharraf Hussain: Remember Dhan-Nun, when he left Nineveh angrily thinking We wouldn’t restrain or question him. He prayed in the depths of darkness: “There is no god except You. Glory be to You; I was wrong.”

88.Musharraf Hussain: We saved and rescued him from distress, and that’s how We save the believers.

89.Musharraf Hussain: And remember Zakariyya, when He called to His Lord: “My Lord, do not leave me childless, you are the best of inheritors.”

90.Musharraf Hussain: We answered him, gave him Yahya and healed his wife. They were always quick to do good works, pray to Us with profound longing and fear, they were humble before Us

91.Musharraf Hussain: Mention the lady who protected her chastity; We breathed in her Our Spirit, and made her and her son a miraculous sign for all people.

92.Musharraf Hussain: This is your community, a single united community. I am your Lord, so worship Me.

93.Musharraf Hussain: Unfortunately, people tore the unity of their religion; all will be returning to Us.

94.Musharraf Hussain: Whoever does righteous deeds as a believer, the reward of their good efforts will not be denied to them, We record it for them.

95.Musharraf Hussain: The communities We destroyed just couldn’t turn away from their evil ways

96.Musharraf Hussain: When Gog and Magog are let loose – rushing down swiftly from every direction ‒

97.Musharraf Hussain: the true promise will draw near, then the disbelievers will watch in horror and say, “Woe to us, we were not aware of this; in fact, we were wrong.”

98.Musharraf Hussain: It will be said: “You and those you worshipped beside Allah are the fuel of Hell; that is where you will go.”

99.Musharraf Hussain: If these were really your gods then they wouldn’t be here. They will stay there forever,

101.Musharraf Hussain: The people We promised Heaven will be kept far away from Hell.

102.Musharraf Hussain: They won’t hear the slightest noise of Hell; they will have whatever they want forever.

103.Musharraf Hussain: They won’t be distressed by the great terror of Judgement Day. The angels will greet them saying, “This is your Day, which you were promised.”

104.Musharraf Hussain: That Day We will roll up the sky like the writer rolls up the scroll. We will recreate as We created the first time; it’s a promise We’ve undertaken and will fulfil it

105.Musharraf Hussain: In the Psalms and the previous Scriptures, We wrote: “My righteous servants will inherit the Earth.”

106.Musharraf Hussain: In this Quran is a message for the worshippers.

107.Musharraf Hussain: We sent you, Messenger, as a kindness for all the worlds.

108.Musharraf Hussain: Say: “It is revealed to me, Your Lord is one, so won’t you submit?”

109.Musharraf Hussain: If they turn away, say: “I have declared what you’ve been promised; I am not sure whether it is near or far.

110.Musharraf Hussain: He knows what you say openly and what you hide.

111.Musharraf Hussain: What do I know? This may be a test for you or a respite in the form of enjoyment for a short while.”

112.Musharraf Hussain: The messenger prayed: “My Lord, make fair judgement. Our Lord the Kind is the One Whose Help is sought against what you say.

1.Musharraf Hussain: People, fear Your Lord. The Earthquake of the Final Hour will be a significant event:

2.Musharraf Hussain: you will see every breastfeeding mother forget her suckling baby, every pregnant woman will miscarry, and every person will appear drunk that day, though they won’t be drunk, but such will be the severity of Allah’s punishment.

3.Musharraf Hussain: There are some people who argue about Allah without any knowledge, and follow every rebellious demon.

4.Musharraf Hussain: It is decreed: Whoever befriends Satan, he will misguide him and lead him towards the punishment of the blazing Fire

5.Musharraf Hussain: People, if you are in any doubt about the resurrection, We originally created you from clay, then from a drop of semen, this became a clot of blood, then a lump of flesh – some parts recognisable others unrecognisable – then a foetus. We revealed this to make the Resurrection clear for you. We plant in wombs whatever We choose for a fixed term, then We bring you out as a baby; then you reach maturity, after which some of you die young while others proceed to feeble old age, to the extent that they know nothing after having known so much. Likewise, you see the Earth appear lifeless; then, when We send down rain, it stirs and swells, producing beautiful pairs of plants

6.Musharraf Hussain: This shows Allah is the Truth. He brings the dead back to life, and has power over all things.

7.Musharraf Hussain: The Final Hour is coming without a doubt – when Allah will resurrect all who are in their graves

8.Musharraf Hussain: People argue about Allah without knowledge or guidance, or any enlightening book,

9.Musharraf Hussain: turning aside disapprovingly to cause others to stray from Allah’s way. Such a person will be disgraced in this world, and on Judgement Day We will make him taste the punishment of the blazing inferno.

10.Musharraf Hussain: He will be told: “That’s what your hands produced. Allah isn’t at all unjust to His servants.

11.Musharraf Hussain: People who worship Allah doubting Him, are satisfied at the best of times, but at the worst of times they go back to their old ways, losing in both, this world and the next; that is a big loss.

12.Musharraf Hussain: Instead of Allah they call on what cannot harm or benefit them. That’s straying far away.

13.Musharraf Hussain: In fact, they call on that which is more likely to harm than benefit them. What wretched allies, and what wretched company!

14.Musharraf Hussain: However, Allah will admit into gardens beneath which rivers flow those who believe and do righteous deeds. Allah does what He wishes.

15.Musharraf Hussain: Whoever imagines that Allah will not help Muhammad either in this world or the next, let him hang himself from a rope tied to the ceiling then cut it off and see if his cunning plan has made his anger go away.

16.Musharraf Hussain: That is how We have sent the Quran down as clear verses; and Allah guides whomever He wishes

17.Musharraf Hussain: The Muslims, the Jews, the Sabians, the Christians, the Zoroastrians, and the idolaters, We shall decide between them on Judgement Day. Allah witnesses everything.

18.Musharraf Hussain: Don’t you see whatever is in the Heavens and on Earth prostrates before Allah: the sun, the moon, the stars, the mountains, the trees, the animals, and many people; but there are many who justly deserve punishment. Anyone Allah disgraces will have no one to honour him. Allah does whatever He pleases

19.Musharraf Hussain: These are two opposite groups who argue about their Lord, those who disbelieve will have suits cut out of fire, and scalding water poured over their heads,

20.Musharraf Hussain: causing their insides and their skins to dissolve;

21.Musharraf Hussain: and they will be restrained with iron rods.

22.Musharraf Hussain: Whenever, out of agony, they try to escape their torment, they will be returned into it and told: “Taste the punishment of the blazing inferno.”

23.Musharraf Hussain: However, Allah will admit those who believe and do righteous deeds into gardens with rivers flowing beneath them; they will be decorated with bracelets of gold and pearls, and their clothes will be of silk –

24.Musharraf Hussain: those who were guided in this world to the very best of speech, and were guided to the path of the Praiseworthy,

25.Musharraf Hussain: but not those who disbelieve and block others from Allah’s way and from the Sacred Mosque, which We established for all the people, whether resident or traveller. Anyone who seeks to violate its sanctity by wrongdoing, We shall make him taste a painful punishment

26.Musharraf Hussain: Remember when We marked out for Ibrahim the place of the Ancient House, saying: “Don’t associate anything with Me; keep My House clean for those who circle it, worship there, standing, bowing and prostrating.

27.Musharraf Hussain: Announce the pilgrimage to people. They will come to you on foot and mounted on all kinds of lean camels, through every deep mountain pass,

28.Musharraf Hussain: to take part in rites that benefit them and to invoke the name of Allah on specific days over such livestock as He has provided for them to sacrifice. Eat the cattle, and feed the needy and poor.

29.Musharraf Hussain: Then complete the rites of cleansing, fulfil the vows, and circle the Ancient House.

30.Musharraf Hussain: Anyone who respects the sacred rites of Allah shall fare better in the Lord’s sight. Livestock is lawful for you except ones already mentioned. Stay away from the impurity of idols, and words of falsehood.

31.Musharraf Hussain: Incline towards Allah without associating partners with Him. The one who associates partners with Allah, is like the one fallen from the sky, and birds snatch at him, or like the wind that carries him off to a faraway place.

32.Musharraf Hussain: Anyone who respects Allah’s symbols, displays true piety of the heart.

33.Musharraf Hussain: There are benefits for you in those symbols for a designated period, the rites conclude at the place of sacrifice near the Ancient House

34.Musharraf Hussain: We prescribed a rite of sacrifice for every community, so they may invoke the name of Allah over such livestock as provided for them. Your God is One God, so submit to Him. And, Messenger, give glad tidings to humble servants

35.Musharraf Hussain: whose hearts tremble at the mention of Allah, respond patiently to any affliction, perform the prayer and spend in charity from what We provided them

36.Musharraf Hussain: The sacrificial camels you find valuable are included among Allah’s symbols; so invoke Allah’s name on them as they stand ready for slaughter; and, once they have fallen dead on their side, eat from them and feed the needy, whether they ask or not. That is how We tamed them for you, so you may be thankful.

37.Musharraf Hussain: Neither their meat nor their blood reaches Allah, but it is your piety that reaches Allah. That’s how We made them obedient for you, so praise Allah for guiding you. Give glad tidings to the righteous

38.Musharraf Hussain: Allah will defend the believers, Allah dislikes ungrateful traitors.

39.Musharraf Hussain: Permission to fight is given to those who were attacked because they have been wronged; and Allah has the power to help those

40.Musharraf Hussain: who were unfairly driven out of their homes for saying, “Our Lord is Allah.” If Allah didn’t defend some people by means of others, then monasteries, churches, synagogues and mosques where Allah’s name is regularly praised would have been destroyed. Allah will support whoever supports His cause. Allah is Strong, Almighty.

41.Musharraf Hussain: If We granted some people authority on Earth, they would establish the prayer, collect Zakat, enjoin the common good and forbid evil. The outcome in all matters is determined by Allah

42.Musharraf Hussain: If today they are denying you, then long before them the people of Nuh, Ad and Thamud denied their prophets too;

43.Musharraf Hussain: likewise the people of Ibrahim and of Lut,

44.Musharraf Hussain: and the inhabitants of Madyan. Even Musa was denied. So I gave the disbelievers time to think, then I seized them. How great was My rejection of their actions!

45.Musharraf Hussain: How many towns have We destroyed whilst they were doing wrong, so today their buildings are razed to the ground, and wells are abandoned; and how many lofty palaces?

46.Musharraf Hussain: Have they not travelled the Earth, so you would think they had either minds with which to reflect or ears with which to hear? In truth, it’s not the lack of sight that causes blindness but lack of insight, which is found in people’s chests

47.Musharraf Hussain: They ask you to bring forward the punishment, but Allah will never break His promise. Your Lord’s single day is like a thousand years by your calculations.

48.Musharraf Hussain: I granted respite to many towns whilst they were doing wrong, then I seized them; and to Me is the final return.

49.Musharraf Hussain: Say: “People, I’m only a clear warner to you.”

50.Musharraf Hussain: As for those who believe and do righteous deeds, they will have forgiveness and generous provision;

51.Musharraf Hussain: but those who strive against Our signs will be the companions of Hell, in vain

52.Musharraf Hussain: We haven’t sent a single messenger or prophet before you who recited Our revelation, but Satan suggested errors in his recitation. Allah removes whatever Satan suggests, then Allah makes clear His verses – Allah is Knowing, Wise –

53.Musharraf Hussain: thereby turning whatever Satan suggests into a test for those in whose hearts is sickness and for the hard of heart. The wrongdoers are far removed from the truth.

54.Musharraf Hussain: And Allah does this so those given knowledge should know that it is the truth from your Lord and believe in it, their hearts turning to Him in humility. Allah guides the believers towards a straight path.

55.Musharraf Hussain: The disbelievers will continue to be in doubt about the truth until the Final Hour comes abruptly, or the punishment of a barren day

56.Musharraf Hussain: On that Day, Allah will have the authority to judge between them. Those who believed and did righteous deeds will be in the gardens of delight,

57.Musharraf Hussain: but those who disbelieved and rejected Our signs will have a humiliating punishment.

58.Musharraf Hussain: Those who migrated for the sake of Allah, or were killed or died on the way, Allah will provide for them handsomely – and Allah is the best Provider –

59.Musharraf Hussain: admitting them to a place that pleases them. Allah is Knowing, Gentle

60.Musharraf Hussain: That is Allah’s command, and whoever retaliates in equal measure to any injury received, and is then wronged again, Allah will support him to regain his right. Allah is Pardoning, Forgiving.

61.Musharraf Hussain: Allah merges night into day and day into night, and Allah is Hearing, Seeing.

62.Musharraf Hussain: That is also because Allah alone is Real, and anything else they call on besides Him is false. It is Allah who is the Exalted, the Great

63.Musharraf Hussain: Have you not considered how Allah sends rain from the sky, turning the Earth green? Allah is Subtle, Aware.

64.Musharraf Hussain: Everything in the Heavens and the Earth belongs to Him. Allah is the Self-Sufficient, the Praiseworthy.

65.Musharraf Hussain: Have you not considered how Allah made everything on Earth to serve you? Ships sail on the sea by His command, and He holds the sky in place so that it does not fall on to the Earth; everything happens with His permission. Allah is Compassionate, Kind to people.

66.Musharraf Hussain: It is He who brought you to life, then causes you to die, and will then bring you back to life. How ungrateful are humans!

67.Musharraf Hussain: We prescribed rituals for every community to practise. So let them not argue with you over such matters. Instead invite them to your Lord, for you are guided on a straight path.

68.Musharraf Hussain: If they argue with you, say: “Allah knows best what you are doing.

69.Musharraf Hussain: Allah will decide between you on Judgement Day regarding your differences.”

70.Musharraf Hussain: Do you not accept that Allah knows whatever exists in the sky and on Earth? All is recorded in a Book, that’s easy for Allah

71.Musharraf Hussain: They worship beside Allah things for which no authority has been revealed, nor do they have knowledge. Consequently, such wrongdoers shall have no helper.

72.Musharraf Hussain: Whenever you recite Our clear verses to them, you can recognise disapproval on the disbelievers’ faces, to the extent that they are almost violent towards those who recite Our verses to them. Say: “Shall I inform you of something even worse? The Fire which Allah has promised those who disbelieve. A wretched destination!

73.Musharraf Hussain: People, here is an example, so listen to it carefully: the idols you worship beside Allah can’t create a fly, even if they all got together to do so. In fact, if a fly were to snatch something from them, they would be unable to take it back. How weak are both the devotee and the object of devotion!

74.Musharraf Hussain: They fail to accord Allah the power that He deserves. Allah is Strong, Mighty.

75.Musharraf Hussain: Allah chooses messengers from among the angels and humans; Allah is Hearing, Seeing.

76.Musharraf Hussain: He knows their past, and future deeds, and eventually all affairs return to Allah

77.Musharraf Hussain: Believers, bow down and prostrate in worship of your Lord, and do good so you may succeed.

78.Musharraf Hussain: Strive for the sake of Allah to do what is right, as much as He deserves. He chose you and placed no hardship in the religion. It is the way of worship of your father Ibrahim. Long ago he named you “Muslims”, as in this Quran, so that the Messenger might stand witness against you if you strayed, and that you might stand witness against humanity’s vices. So perform the prayer, give Zakat and hold firmly to faith in Allah your Protector. How excellent a Protector, and how excellent a Helper

1.Musharraf Hussain: The believers have succeeded:

2.Musharraf Hussain: those who are humbly focused in their prayer;

3.Musharraf Hussain: who turn away from meaningless activities;

4.Musharraf Hussain: who give Zakat;

5.Musharraf Hussain: who guard their modesty and sexual purity,

6.Musharraf Hussain: except from their spouses or their slaves, in which case they are free from blame –

7.Musharraf Hussain: but whoever desires sexual gratification beyond that are transgressors –

8.Musharraf Hussain: who honour trusts placed in them and their contract;

9.Musharraf Hussain: and regularly perform their prayers.

10.Musharraf Hussain: Such people are the true heirs,

11.Musharraf Hussain: they will inherit Paradise, living in it forever

12.Musharraf Hussain: We first created humanity from an extract of clay.

13.Musharraf Hussain: Thereafter born, We placed him as a drop of semen in the stable environment of the womb.

14.Musharraf Hussain: The drop of semen turned to a blood-like clot; and, from the blood-like clot, We made the fleshy lump into bones and covered them with flesh; then We produce from it another created being. Blessed is Allah, the best Creator.

15.Musharraf Hussain: After all that, you will die,

16.Musharraf Hussain: and on Judgement Day you will be resurrected

17.Musharraf Hussain: We created seven orbits of the Heavens above you; and We never neglected Our creation.

18.Musharraf Hussain: We send rain from the sky in exact measure, and We hold it in the Earth; and We are equally capable of taking it away.

19.Musharraf Hussain: With water, We produce gardens of date palms and grape vines. There is plenty of fruit for you to eat.

20.Musharraf Hussain: We produced a tree that grows on the side of Mount Sinai, it produces olive oil, a seasoning for people to eat.

21.Musharraf Hussain: The livestock offer you a lesson; We give you to drink from what is in their bellies, not to mention the many other benefits in them, and you eat their meat,

22.Musharraf Hussain: and they carry you across the land. And you’re transported by the ships

23.Musharraf Hussain: We sent Nuh to his people, he preached: “My people, worship Allah; you have no other god beside Him. Won’t you be mindful of Him?”

24.Musharraf Hussain: The leaders of disbelievers of his community said, “He is only a mortal like yourselves, who wants dominance over you. If Allah so wished, He would have sent angels. Never have we heard the like of this from our forefathers.

25.Musharraf Hussain: He’s just a man who’s mad, so bear with him a while till he recovers.”

26.Musharraf Hussain: Nuh said, “My Lord, help me, they’ve denied me.

27.Musharraf Hussain: Eventually We inspired him: “Build a ship under Our supervision and according to Our instructions; then, when Our command comes, and the geysers begin to flood, then take aboard two of every kind of creature and your family, except those who’ve already been condemned. And do not speak to me about the evildoers. They are as good as drowned.

28.Musharraf Hussain: Then, once you and your followers are onboard the ship, say: ‘Praise be to Allah, Who has rescued us from the wrongdoers,’

29.Musharraf Hussain: and say: ‘My Lord, settle me in a blessed place, for You are the best provider of a home.’”

30.Musharraf Hussain: In this are signs. We have always put people to the test

31.Musharraf Hussain: We raised another generation after them,

32.Musharraf Hussain: and sent a messenger from themselves, who said: “Worship Allah; you have no other god beside Him. Will you not be mindful of Him?”

33.Musharraf Hussain: The leaders of disbelievers from his community who denied meeting Allah in the Hereafter, and those We lavished with luxuries in this worldly life, said, “He’s only a human like yourselves; he eats what you eat and drinks what you drink.

34.Musharraf Hussain: If you were to obey a human like yourselves, you would be losers.

35.Musharraf Hussain: “Does he promise that, when you die and turn to dust and bones, you will be brought out of your graves?

36.Musharraf Hussain: What you are promised is utter nonsense!

37.Musharraf Hussain: This worldly life of ours is it! We will live, die, and we will not be resurrected.

38.Musharraf Hussain: He is only a man who has made up lies about Allah, so we won’t believe him.”

39.Musharraf Hussain: The messenger said, “My Lord, help me because they’ve denied me.”

40.Musharraf Hussain: Allah said, “They will regret, soon.”

41.Musharraf Hussain: The Blast took them by surprise; and We turned them into dust. So away with the evildoers!

42.Musharraf Hussain: We raised other generations after them.

43.Musharraf Hussain: No community can bring forward or delay its fixed lifespan

44.Musharraf Hussain: We continued sending Our messengers, one after another. Each time their messenger came to a community, they denied him. So, We made one community succeed another, and We made of them tales to be told. So away with people who do not believe!

45.Musharraf Hussain: After that We sent Musa and his brother, Harun, with Our signs and a clear proof

46.Musharraf Hussain: to Pharaoh and his court, but they were arrogant and too proud.

47.Musharraf Hussain: They said, “Should we believe two men like ourselves, whose people are our slaves?”

48.Musharraf Hussain: So they denied them and were destroyed.

49.Musharraf Hussain: We gave Musa the Book so they may be guided.

50.Musharraf Hussain: We made the son of Maryam and his mother a sign; We gave them refuge on a hilltop, a peaceful place with a natural spring.

51.Musharraf Hussain: Messengers, eat of what is pure wholesome and do good deeds; I know well what you do.

52.Musharraf Hussain: This community of yours is a single community, and I am your Lord, so be mindful of Me

53.Musharraf Hussain: Their successors split up into sects, each sect pleased with itself.

54.Musharraf Hussain: So leave them wallowing in their confusion for a while.

55.Musharraf Hussain: Do they reckon We granted them wealth and children because

56.Musharraf Hussain: We are in a rush to do whatever is good for them? On the contrary, they have no sense of what is coming.

57.Musharraf Hussain: However, those who fear their Lord;

58.Musharraf Hussain: believe in the signs of their Lord;

59.Musharraf Hussain: don’t associate partners with their Lord;

60.Musharraf Hussain: give charity from what they have been given, while their hearts tremble at the thought that they will be returning to their Lord;

61.Musharraf Hussain: they rush to do whatever is good, they are the high fliers

62.Musharraf Hussain: We don’t task anyone beyond their capacity, and We keep a Book with Us that speaks the truth; so they shall not be wronged.

63.Musharraf Hussain: However, there’s confusion in their minds about this; and the wrongdoers have even worse deeds than this, which they continue to do

64.Musharraf Hussain: until We seize their well-off for punishment; then they will cry out.

65.Musharraf Hussain: “Don’t cry today,” they will be told, “You will find no help against Us.

66.Musharraf Hussain: When My verses were recited, you turned on your heels and walked away,

67.Musharraf Hussain: arrogantly talking nonsense late into the night.”

68.Musharraf Hussain: Haven’t they reflected on what is said in the Quran? Or has something come to them that never came to their forefathers?

69.Musharraf Hussain: Or is it that they don’t recognise their messenger, and so they reject him?

70.Musharraf Hussain: Or do they say that he’s possessed? On the contrary, he has come to them with the truth, but most of them hate it

71.Musharraf Hussain: If Allah, the truth was to follow their whims, then the Heavens and the Earth and whatever exists in them would have fallen into ruin. We brought them a reminder, but they turned away from their reminder.

72.Musharraf Hussain: Or did you ask them to pay you something? The payment of your Lord is better by far; and He is the best Provider.

73.Musharraf Hussain: At the same time as you are calling them to the straight path,

74.Musharraf Hussain: those who deny the Hereafter have turned away from the path

75.Musharraf Hussain: If We were kind to them and removed all hardship from them, they would still wander about disobediently.

76.Musharraf Hussain: We punished them once before, and they didn’t surrender to their Lord, nor showed humility

77.Musharraf Hussain: until We opened the gate of punishment on them, and they fell into despair.

78.Musharraf Hussain: He gave you hearing, sight and mind. How little did you thank Him!

79.Musharraf Hussain: He scattered you all over the Earth, and eventually you will be gathered before Him.

80.Musharraf Hussain: He grants life and death, and His is the cycle of night and day. Don’t you understand

81.Musharraf Hussain: On the contrary, the Makkans say the same as their ancestors.

82.Musharraf Hussain: They said: “When we are dead and turned to dust and bones, will we be resurrected?

83.Musharraf Hussain: We and our forefathers were promised this before. These are mere tales of the past.”

84.Musharraf Hussain: Say, Muhammad: “To Whom does the Earth and whoever lives on it belong, if you have knowledge?”

85.Musharraf Hussain: They will say, “To Allah!” Say: “Why then don’t you pay attention?”

86.Musharraf Hussain: Say: “Who is the Lord of the Seven Heavens and the Lord of the Mighty Throne?”

87.Musharraf Hussain: Again they will say, “Allah!” Say: “Why aren’t you mindful of Him?”

88.Musharraf Hussain: Say: “In Whose hand lies the control over everything, He protects, but against Him there is no protection, if you have knowledge?”

89.Musharraf Hussain: They will say, “Allah!” Say: “So why are you bewitched?”

90.Musharraf Hussain: On the other hand, We brought them the truth, but they deny it

91.Musharraf Hussain: Allah has not taken a son, nor is there any other god with Him. If it had been so, each god would have gone off with what it had created, and some of them would be superior to others. Glory to Allah, Who is far removed from what they ascribe to Him!

92.Musharraf Hussain: The Knower of all that is seen and unseen, Sublimely exalted above whatever they associate with Him

93.Musharraf Hussain: Say: “My Lord, if You must show me what they’ve been promised

94.Musharraf Hussain: then, My Lord, don’t include me among the wrongdoers.”

95.Musharraf Hussain: We are quite capable of showing you what We promised them.

96.Musharraf Hussain: Repel evil with good. We know well what they ascribe to Us.

97.Musharraf Hussain: And say: “My Lord, I seek refuge in You from the murmurings of devils;

98.Musharraf Hussain: and I seek Your refuge from harm they may cause me.”

99.Musharraf Hussain: Only when death comes to one of them will he say, “My Lord, let me return to my life on Earth

100.Musharraf Hussain: so that I may act righteously in whatever I previously omitted.” Never! What he is saying are empty words; and before them lies a vast barrier, uncrossable till the day they are resurrected

101.Musharraf Hussain: When the mighty Trumpet is blown, that Day there will be no kinship left between them, nor will they ask about each other.

102.Musharraf Hussain: Anyone whose scales weigh heavy, will be successful;

103.Musharraf Hussain: but anyone whose scales are light will be the loser, staying in Hell forever.

104.Musharraf Hussain: The Fire will scorch their faces, leaving them grinning like skulls.

105.Musharraf Hussain: “Were My verses not recited to you,” they will be asked, “and you rejected them.”

106.Musharraf Hussain: They will say, “Our Lord, misfortune overwhelmed us, and so we went astray.

107.Musharraf Hussain: Our Lord, get us out of here; if we return to acting sinfully, we shall only be wronging ourselves.”

108.Musharraf Hussain: Allah will say, “May you be driven ever deeper into the Fire. Don’t speak to Me.

109.Musharraf Hussain: There was once a group of My servants who used to say, ‘Our Lord, we believe; forgive us and be kind to us, for You are the most Kind.’

110.Musharraf Hussain: However, you took them as a laughing stock, your laughing at them made you forget My remembrance.

111.Musharraf Hussain: This day I shall reward them for their patience. They are the victors.”

112.Musharraf Hussain: Allah will ask, “How long did you live on Earth?”

113.Musharraf Hussain: They will say, “We spent a day or so. Ask those who keep count.”

114.Musharraf Hussain: Allah will say, “You spent but a short while, if only you knew.

115.Musharraf Hussain: Did you reckon We created you without a purpose and you wouldn’t be returned to Us?

116.Musharraf Hussain: Allah is the exalted, the True King! There is no god beside Him, Lord of the Honoured Throne.

117.Musharraf Hussain: Anyone who worships another god for which he has no proof, His Lord will bring him to account. The disbelievers shall never succeed.

118.Musharraf Hussain: And, Messenger, say: “My Lord, forgive and be kind, for You are the Most Kind.

1.Musharraf Hussain: This is a surat that We sent down with laws to be obeyed, and We revealed clear verses so you will pay attention.

2.Musharraf Hussain: Flog the fornicators, male and female, each of them one-hundred lashes, and don’t let sympathy for them hold you back from fulfilling Allah’s orders, if you believe in Allah and the Last Day; and let a group of believers witness their punishment.

3.Musharraf Hussain: A male fornicator only marries a female fornicator or an idolatress; a female fornicator only marries a male fornicator or an idolater; and fornication is forbidden for the believers

4.Musharraf Hussain: Those who accuse chaste women of fornication, but fail to produce four witnesses, should be flogged eighty lashes; and never accept their witness statement again. They are major sinners,

5.Musharraf Hussain: except those who later repent and reform themselves. Allah is Forgiving, Kind.

6.Musharraf Hussain: Anyone who accuses his wife but has no witnesses other than himself, let him swear four times by Allah: he is telling the truth,

7.Musharraf Hussain: and the fifth time he says, Allah’s curse be upon him if he is lying.

8.Musharraf Hussain: Punishment will be averted from her if she also swears by Allah four times that he is lying,

9.Musharraf Hussain: and the fifth time that Allah’s wrath be upon her if he is telling the truth.

10.Musharraf Hussain: Imagine the consequences, if it were not for Allah’s grace towards you and His kindness. Allah is Relenting, Wise

11.Musharraf Hussain: Those who planned the slander were a handful of you, don’t consider it bad for you; in fact, it’s good for you. Each person among them will bear the consequence of his part in the sin; and the one who played the leading role will receive a mighty punishment.

12.Musharraf Hussain: If once they heard it – the believers, male and female – of their own accord should have thought the best of Aisha and said, “This is clearly a slander.”

13.Musharraf Hussain: If they had produced four witnesses, it would be different; but they failed to produce the witnesses, in Allah’s sight they are liars

14.Musharraf Hussain: Were it not for Allah’s grace towards you and His kind treatment in this world and the Hereafter, then a mighty punishment would have affected you all because of the rumour you rushed to spread.

15.Musharraf Hussain: You gave it publicity with your chatter and said things with your mouths you had no knowledge of, thinking it was a trivial, but in the sight of Allah it was serious.

16.Musharraf Hussain: If only, when you heard it, you had said: “It is not fitting for us to talk about this. Glory be to Him! This is a terrible slander.”

17.Musharraf Hussain: Allah warns you: never repeat such behaviour again if you are believers.

18.Musharraf Hussain: Allah is explaining the verses for you. Allah is Knowing, Wise

19.Musharraf Hussain: Those who like to spread indecency among the believers will suffer a painful punishment in this worldly life and the Hereafter. Allah knows what you don’t know.

20.Musharraf Hussain: Imagine the consequences, if it were not for Allah’s grace towards you and His kindness. Allah is Compassionate, Kind.

21.Musharraf Hussain: Believers, don’t follow in Satan’s footsteps. Whoever follows Satan’s footsteps will find that he urges indecency and shameful acts. If it weren’t for Allah’s grace on you and His kindness, none of you would be pure, Allah purifies anyone He pleases. Allah is the Hearer, the Knower

22.Musharraf Hussain: Those of you who possess status and means shouldn’t vow to stop giving to relatives, the needy and those who emigrated for the sake of Allah. Let them pardon and overlook their shortcomings. Wouldn’t you like Allah to forgive you? Allah is Forgiving, Kind

23.Musharraf Hussain: Those who falsely accuse careless but nonetheless chaste believing women shall be cursed here and the Hereafter, and will be severely punished,

24.Musharraf Hussain: on the Day tongues, hands and feet will testify against them for what they did.

25.Musharraf Hussain: That Day, Allah will settle their account for them in full, and they will know Allah alone is the Truth, the Clarifier.

26.Musharraf Hussain: Vile women are fit for vile men, and vile men are fit for vile women; and likewise, moral women are for moral men, and moral men are for moral women. Such people are innocent of what others say about them; they will be forgiven and have generous provision

27.Musharraf Hussain: Believers, don’t enter any houses other than your own homes until you have made yourselves known and greeted the occupants; that’s best for you, so you may pay heed.

28.Musharraf Hussain: If there is no one in, then don’t enter until permission is given; and if you are told, “Go back!” Then go back: that is the best course of action for you. Allah knows well what you do.

29.Musharraf Hussain: You can enter without permission a non-residential place that provides you amenities, Allah knows well what you reveal and what you conceal.

30.Musharraf Hussain: Tell believing men to lower their gaze and be modest; that is the best for them. Allah is aware of what they do.

31.Musharraf Hussain: And tell believing women to lower their gaze and be modest; they shouldn’t expose their beauty in public, except what is normally showing; and cover their bosoms with headscarves; they should only display beauty to their husbands, fathers, fathers-in-law, sons, stepsons, brothers, brothers’ sons, sisters’ sons, female servants, slaves, any male attendants who are free of sexual desire, and children who are indifferent to the sight of women’s private parts; and they shouldn’t stamp their feet to draw attention to the beauty which they hide beneath their clothes. Believers, turn to Allah, all of you, so you may be successful here and the Hereafter

32.Musharraf Hussain: Help the unmarried people amongst you to marry, and your righteous male servants and maids. Even if they are poor, Allah will make them self-sufficient through His grace. Allah is Vast, All-Knowing.

33.Musharraf Hussain: And let those who lack the means to marry keep themselves chaste until Allah makes them self-sufficient through His grace. If any of your slaves asks for an emancipation contract, and you see some good in them, draft it for them; and give them of the wealth that Allah has given you. For your cravings to make worldly gains do not force your maidservants into promiscuity, if they wish to remain chaste, merely because you desire what this worldly life has to offer. Whoever forces them into it, then Allah will be Forgiving, Kind to those maidservants after being coerced to perform sexual intercourse.

34.Musharraf Hussain: We sent down to you clarifying verses and an example of those who passed away before you, as well as teachings for those who are mindful of Allah

35.Musharraf Hussain: Allah is the Light of the Heavens and the Earth. An example of His Light is a niche in which there is a lamp; the lamp glowing in a glass; the glass bright like a brilliant shining star, fuelled from a blessed olive tree, neither of the East nor of the West; its oil shines even though untouched by any flame; light upon light. Allah guides whomever He pleases towards His Light. Allah gives people examples and has full knowledge of all things.

36.Musharraf Hussain: Such lamps are to be found in houses that Allah has permitted to be erected, and in which His name is mentioned; and where, glorifying Him morning and evening,

37.Musharraf Hussain: are men who are not distracted by buying and selling from Allah’s remembrance, performing the prayer, and paying Zakat. They dread a day when hearts and eyes will be wandering,

38.Musharraf Hussain: hoping Allah will reward them according to the best they did and give them more from His grace. Allah provides without limit for whomever He pleases

39.Musharraf Hussain: However, the disbelievers deeds are like a mirage in a desert: the thirsty traveller imagines it to be water until he reaches it, only to find nothing there; but finds Allah before him, settling his account in full. Allah is swift in calculating accounts.

40.Musharraf Hussain: Or their deeds are like veils of darkness in the deep sea covered by wave upon wave, over which clouds loom. The layers of darkness lie so densely over one another that, if one takes one’s hand out of the water, one can barely see it. Anyone Allah deprives of light will have no light at all

41.Musharraf Hussain: Haven’t you considered, everything in the Heavens and the Earth glorifies Allah? The birds flying in flocks, each one knows how it should pray and glorify Him; and Allah knows what they do.

42.Musharraf Hussain: Allah controls the Heavens and the Earth, and to Him is the final return.

43.Musharraf Hussain: Haven’t you considered how Allah moves the clouds along, joins them together, then piles them up until you see rain pouring from them. On mountains, He sends down from the sky hailstones that strike whomever He wills and spare whomever He wills; and the flash of its lightning nearly takes away one’s sight.

44.Musharraf Hussain: Allah causes the succession of night and day; in that are lessons for people of insight.

45.Musharraf Hussain: Moreover, Allah created every creature from water; some crawl on their bellies, others walk on two feet or on four. Allah creates whatever He wills. Allah has power over all things

46.Musharraf Hussain: We revealed verses that clearly explain, and by them Allah guides anyone who wants to be guided towards a straight path.

47.Musharraf Hussain: People will say: “We believe in Allah and in the Messenger, and we obey,” but afterwards a group of them turns away: such people are not believers.

48.Musharraf Hussain: When they are summoned to Allah and his Messenger for judgement, a group of them objects.

49.Musharraf Hussain: Had the decision been in their favour they would have submitted willingly.

50.Musharraf Hussain: Is there sickness in their hearts? Or do they have doubts? Or are they afraid that Allah and His Messenger will deal with them unjustly? Such people are sinners

51.Musharraf Hussain: The believers’ response, when they are summoned to Allah and His Messenger for judgement, is: “We hear and obey.” These are the successful.

52.Musharraf Hussain: Whoever obeys Allah and His Messenger, and fears Allah and is mindful of Him, these are the victorious.

53.Musharraf Hussain: Hypocrites swear by Allah, using their strongest oaths, that if you were to command them, they would march out to battle. Say: “Don’t swear. Obedience is recognisable!” Allah is aware of your works.

54.Musharraf Hussain: Say: “Obey Allah, and obey the Messenger. Then, if you choose to turn away, he will answer only for what he has taken on, and you will answer for what you have taken on. If you obey him, you will be guided. The responsibility of the Messenger is to convey the message clearly.

55.Musharraf Hussain: Allah has promised to make the believers and the righteous His deputies on Earth, as He made those before you His deputies; and He will make their religion strong, which pleases Him; and He will remove their fear and make them feel safe, since they worship Me alone, and don’t associate any partners with Me. The disbelievers are the evildoers.

56.Musharraf Hussain: So, perform the prayer, pay Zakat, and obey the Messenger in order to be treated kindly.

57.Musharraf Hussain: Never think the disbelievers can defeat Allah’s plan on Earth. The Fire is their place of refuge. What a wretched home

58.Musharraf Hussain: Believers, your slaves and children who haven’t yet reached puberty should ask permission before entering your room three times of the day: before the dawn prayer, at midday when you get undressed, and after the evening prayer – three times of your privacy, outside these times there is no blame on you or them to wander in and out of each other’s rooms. That is how Allah makes His verses clear for you. Allah is Knowing, Wise.

59.Musharraf Hussain: When your children reach puberty, they must ask permission like those mentioned before. That is how Allah makes His verses clear for you. Allah is Knowing, Wise

60.Musharraf Hussain: Older women who have no desire to marry may remove their outer garments as long as they don’t display any beauty, there’s no blame on them. However, even for them it’s better to remain modest. Allah is Hearing, Knowing

61.Musharraf Hussain: There is no restriction on the blind, the disabled, the sick, or yourselves eating in your own homes, or your fathers’ homes, your mothers’ homes, your brothers’, sisters’, paternal or maternal uncles’ and aunts’ homes, or homes whose keys you hold, or at your friends’ homes. It isn’t blameworthy whether you eat together or separately. Whenever you enter houses, greet each other with a sincere blessing from Allah. That is how Allah makes His verses clear for you, so you may reflect

62.Musharraf Hussain: The believers firmly believe in Allah and His Messenger, and when they are with him discussing any matter of general concern, don’t leave without seeking his permission. Those who seek your permission are true believers in Allah and His Messenger. If they ask your permission to attend to some private matter of theirs, give them permission as you wish, and seek Allah’s forgiveness for them. Allah is Forgiving, Kind

63.Musharraf Hussain: Do not call out in a loud voice to the Messenger as you would call out to each other. Allah knows those of you who quietly slip away to avoid being given a task. Those who disagree with his commandment should beware in case they find themselves tested or are struck by a painful punishment.

64.Musharraf Hussain: Doesn’t everything in the Heavens and the Earth belong to Allah? He knows exactly where you stand; and, on the Day all are returned to Him, He will inform them of what they did. Allah has full knowledge of all things.In the name of Allah, the Kind, the Caring

1.Musharraf Hussain: Blessed is the One Who sent down the benchmark to His noble servant: the warner for all communities;

2.Musharraf Hussain: Allah controls the Heavens and the Earth, has not adopted a child, nor taken a partner in His dominion, and has created everything carefully measured out.

3.Musharraf Hussain: Yet the disbelievers have adopted beside Him gods that create nothing but were created, they have no power to harm or to benefit themselves, and don’t control death, life or resurrection

4.Musharraf Hussain: The disbelievers said, “This is nothing but an outrageous lie that he has made up with the support of some people.” In truth, it is they who have come to do wrong and bear false witness.

5.Musharraf Hussain: And they said, “These are the tales of the ancients he has written down, that were dictated to him morning and evening.”

6.Musharraf Hussain: Say: “He sent it down, Who knows the secrets concealed in the Heavens and the Earth. He is Forgiving, Kind.”

7.Musharraf Hussain: They said, “What kind of messenger is this who eats food and walks about in the market? If an angel was sent with him as a warner, then we would believe;

8.Musharraf Hussain: or if some treasure came down to him, or he had an orchard for his livelihood.” The wrongdoers say, “You are following a bewitched man.”

9.Musharraf Hussain: Look what examples they make of you! They have gone astray, and they cannot find a straight path.

10.Musharraf Hussain: Blessed is He Who will grant you better than that when He wants; gardens beneath which rivers flow and luxurious palaces

11.Musharraf Hussain: They have denied the coming of the Final Hour, and We have prepared a fiery blaze for anyone who denies the Final Hour.

12.Musharraf Hussain: When it sees them from afar, they will hear it raging and roaring;

13.Musharraf Hussain: and they will be chained together and cast into a narrow pit in it; they will plead to perish.

14.Musharraf Hussain: “Do not plead to perish once today,” they’ll be told, “but plead to perish many times over.”

15.Musharraf Hussain: Say: “Which is better, that or the garden of eternal life that those mindful of Allah have been promised?” That will be their reward and destination,

16.Musharraf Hussain: they will have whatever they please forever: a promise which Your Lord will fulfil

17.Musharraf Hussain: On the Day He gathers them and all they worship beside Allah, He will ask: “Was it you who led My servants astray, or did they stray by themselves from the path?

18.Musharraf Hussain: The idols will say, “Glory be to You! It was not for us to take on protectors besides You. However, You let them and their forefathers enjoy themselves until they neglected the Reminder and were ruined people.”

19.Musharraf Hussain: “Your idols have denied what you said,” He will tell them, “You can’t avert what’s coming or get help. So whoever continues doing wrong, then We’ll let them taste a dreadful punishment.

20.Musharraf Hussain: Never before you, Muhammad, have We sent any messenger who didn’t eat food and walk about in the markets. We made some of you a test for others to see how patient you will be. Your Lord is Seeing.

21.Musharraf Hussain: Those who don’t like to meet Us say: “If angels were sent down, or we could see our Lord we would have believed.” They are proud of themselves and rude.

22.Musharraf Hussain: On the Day they see the angels, it won’t be good news for the sinners; the angels will say, “Paradise is a forbidden place for you!”

23.Musharraf Hussain: Whatever deeds they had done, We will turn them into scattered dust.

18.Musharraf Hussain: and they marched until they came to the Valley of Ants, where one of the ants said: “Ants, get into your anthills so that Sulayman and his armies don’t crush you unwittingly.”

19.Musharraf Hussain: Sulayman smiled and laughed at her words and said, “Lord, make me grateful to You for the blessings that You have given me and my father; and grant me strength to do righteous deeds to please You; and kindly, include me with Your righteous servants.

20.Musharraf Hussain: One day, whilst looking for a missing bird, Sulayman said: “Why can’t I see the Hoopoe? He’s absent?

21.Musharraf Hussain: Either he brings me a valid reason for his absence, or I will punish him severely, maybe even slaughter him!”

22.Musharraf Hussain: The hoopoe did not stay away for long; he returned and said, “I know of something that you don’t, and I bring you an accurate report from Sheba.

23.Musharraf Hussain: There I found a woman ruling over them; and, like you, she has been given everything and has a mighty throne

24.Musharraf Hussain: I found her and her people worshipping the sun instead of Allah, and Satan had made their deeds attractive to them, and blocked them from the true way, so they were not guided.

25.Musharraf Hussain: Shouldn’t they worship only Allah, Who discloses whatever is hidden in the Heavens and the Earth, and Who knows whatever you choose either to conceal or to reveal?

26.Musharraf Hussain: There is no god but Allah, the Lord of the mighty Throne.

27.Musharraf Hussain: Sulayman said, “We shall see if you are telling the truth or lying.

28.Musharraf Hussain: Go with this letter of mine and make sure they receive it, then move a little way from them and see what response they come back with.”

29.Musharraf Hussain: The queen said, “My lords, I have received a gracious letter.

30.Musharraf Hussain: It is from Sulayman and reads: ‘In the name of Allah, the Kind, the Caring.

31.Musharraf Hussain: Do not think yourselves above me, but come to me in submission.

32.Musharraf Hussain: So she asked, “My lords, advise me in this matter. I don’t make any decision without your presence and advice.”

33.Musharraf Hussain: They said, “We possess power and military might, but the final decision rests with you; so, tell us what to do.

34.Musharraf Hussain: She said, “When kings enter a city, they lay waste to it and humiliate its nobility; that is their way.

35.Musharraf Hussain: So I will send them a gift and wait to see what the envoys come back with.”

36.Musharraf Hussain: When they reached Sulayman, he said to her envoys, “Do you think you can increase my wealth? What Allah has given me is far better than what He has given you. Only the likes of you rejoice in such gifts.

37.Musharraf Hussain: Go back to your people and tell them We shall come with armies that they can’t face, and we shall expel them from their city, humiliated and disgraced.

38.Musharraf Hussain: Sulayman asked his courtiers, “Who can bring me her throne before they come to me in submission?”

39.Musharraf Hussain: An Efreet from the jinns said, “I can bring it to you before you get up from your place; I am strong and trustworthy.”

40.Musharraf Hussain: Another, who had knowledge of the Book, said, “I can bring it to you in the blinking of an eye.” When Sulayman saw it installed before him, he said, “This is by My Lord’s favour, to test whether I am grateful or ungrateful. Whoever is grateful is grateful for his own benefit; but whoever is ungrateful harms only himself, as my Lord is Self-Sufficient, Generous.”

41.Musharraf Hussain: He said, “Disguise her throne so that we can see if she is guided or not.

42.Musharraf Hussain: After arriving, the Queen was asked, “Is your throne like this?” She said, “It looks just like it.” And Sulayman said, “We were given prior knowledge, and we submitted to Allah.

43.Musharraf Hussain: What had previously stopped her was what she used to worship beside Allah, as she came from a disbelieving community.”

44.Musharraf Hussain: “Enter the royal chamber,” she was told. When she saw it, she thought it was a pool and so bared her legs to keep her robes dry. Sulayman said, “The chamber is paved with glass.” She said, “My Lord, I have wronged myself, but now I submit with Sulayman to Allah, the Lord of the worlds.

45.Musharraf Hussain: We sent to the people of Thamud their brother Salih, saying: “Worship Allah,” but they split into two groups and began to argue.

46.Musharraf Hussain: Salih said, “My people, why are you in a rush to do evil rather than good? If you would only seek Allah’s forgiveness, you will be shown kindness.”

47.Musharraf Hussain: They said, “We feel uneasy about you and those with you.” He said, “Your feeling of unease rests with Allah. The fact is that, as a people, you are being tested.”

48.Musharraf Hussain: There was a gang of nine men in the city who would not comply but went around wreaking havoc.

49.Musharraf Hussain: They said, “Let us swear by Allah to attack him and his family by night, then tell his guardian that we were not witnesses to his family’s demise and that we are telling the truth.”

50.Musharraf Hussain: They hatched a plot, and so We countered it; but they remained unaware.

51.Musharraf Hussain: Behold the outcome of their plot: We destroyed them all, and their community.

52.Musharraf Hussain: These are their houses, razed to the ground because of their wrongdoing. In that, there is a sign for people who know.

53.Musharraf Hussain: And We saved those who believed and were mindful of Us

54.Musharraf Hussain: And remember Lut, when he said to his people: “How can you commit acts of indecency with your eyes wide open?

55.Musharraf Hussain: Do you approach other men with lust rather than women? You people are utterly foolish.”

56.Musharraf Hussain: The only response they gave: “Expel Lut’s household from your city, they are such puritans.”

57.Musharraf Hussain: So We saved him and his family except for his wife, whom We decreed would stay behind;

58.Musharraf Hussain: and We pelted them with a rain of brimstone. How dreadful was the rain on those who had been forewarned

59.Musharraf Hussain: Say: “Praise be to Allah, and peace be upon His chosen servants! Is Allah better or whatever they associate with Him?”

60.Musharraf Hussain: Who is it Who created the Heavens and the Earth and sends down rain for you from the sky with which We have produced delightful gardens. You cannot make its trees grow? Is there another god along with Allah? On the contrary, they are people who have turned away from truth.

61.Musharraf Hussain: Who is it Who made the Earth a place for you to live, made rivers to flow in it, made mountains, and set a barrier between the two seas? Is there another god along with Allah? No, most of them are ignorant

62.Musharraf Hussain: Who answers the distressed when they cry out to Him, removes suffering, and causes you to inherit the land? Is there another god beside Allah? How little do you reflect!

63.Musharraf Hussain: Who is it Who guides you through the darkness on land and sea; and Who is it Who sends winds heralding glad tidings of His kindness in the form of rain? Is there another god beside Allah? Allah is far exalted above anything they associate as partners with Him

64.Musharraf Hussain: Who sets in motion the process of creation, then returns it to its former state; and Who provides for you from the Earth and sky? Is there another god beside Allah? Say: “Fetch your proof, if you are telling the truth.”

65.Musharraf Hussain: Say: “No one in the Heavens or on Earth has knowledge of the unseen except Allah; nor do they have any knowledge of when they will be resurrected.”

66.Musharraf Hussain: Can their knowledge comprehend the Hereafter? On the contrary, they have doubts about it; in fact, they are blind to it

67.Musharraf Hussain: The disbelievers say, “How can it be that when we and our forefathers have turned to dust we will be brought back to life?

68.Musharraf Hussain: We and our forefathers were promised this before. This is merely a tale of the ancient people.”

69.Musharraf Hussain: Say: “Travel on the Earth and see the fate of the sinners.”

70.Musharraf Hussain: Do not grieve over them, Messenger, nor be anxious about what they are plotting.

71.Musharraf Hussain: They say, “When will this promise be fulfilled, if you are telling the truth?”

72.Musharraf Hussain: Say: “It may be, what you seek to hasten is already close behind you.”

73.Musharraf Hussain: Your Lord is most gracious towards people, but most are ungrateful

74.Musharraf Hussain: And your Lord knows whatever their hearts conceal, and what they reveal.

75.Musharraf Hussain: There is nothing hidden in the Earth or sky which is not found in a Clear Book.

76.Musharraf Hussain: This Quran narrates most of the disagreements of the Israelites.

77.Musharraf Hussain: It is a guidance and kindness for the believers.

78.Musharraf Hussain: Your Lord will decide wisely between them. He is the Almighty, the Knowing.

79.Musharraf Hussain: So trust in Allah, for you are clearly in the right.

80.Musharraf Hussain: You can no more make the deaf hear the call than you can the dead, if they turn their backs on you;

81.Musharraf Hussain: nor are you there to guide the blind away from their error. Only those will hear you who believe in Our signs and submit to Our will

82.Musharraf Hussain: When the judgement against them comes to pass, We shall bring forth from the Earth a beast that will tell them about the people who didn’t believe in Our signs.

83.Musharraf Hussain: And on the Day when We gather from every community an army of those who denied Our signs, they will march in ranks.

84.Musharraf Hussain: And, when they arrive before Him, He will say, “Did you deny My signs despite not comprehending them? If not, what were you doing?”

85.Musharraf Hussain: And, as the decree is passed against them because of their wrongdoing, they will say nothing

86.Musharraf Hussain: Haven’t they seen We made the night for them to rest and the day to give them light? In that, there is a sign for people who believe.

87.Musharraf Hussain: And on the Day that the Trumpet is blown, all those in the Heavens and the Earth will be terrified except those whom Allah pleases to protect; each of them shall come to Him, humbly.

88.Musharraf Hussain: And you will see the mountains, which you thought were fixed, floating like clouds. This is the handiwork of Allah, Who has perfected everything. He is fully aware of what you do.

89.Musharraf Hussain: Whoever brings good deeds with him, shall receive even better in return; and they will be safe from the terror of that Day;

90.Musharraf Hussain: but anyone who comes with evil deeds will be hurled face-down into the Fire and asked: “Have you not been rewarded for what you did?

91.Musharraf Hussain: “I have been ordered to worship the Lord of this city, Who made it sacred, and all things belong to Him; and I have been ordered to be among the committed,

92.Musharraf Hussain: who recite the Quran.” Thereafter, whoever is guided it is for his own benefit; and anyone who goes astray tell them: “I am a warner.”

93.Musharraf Hussain: And say: “Praise be to Allah. He will show you His signs and you will recognise them. Your Lord is not unaware of what you do.

1.Musharraf Hussain: Ta Sin Meem

2.Musharraf Hussain: These are verses of the Clear Book,

3.Musharraf Hussain: in which We recite to you part of the true story of Musa and Pharaoh for those who believe.

4.Musharraf Hussain: Pharaoh was unjust to people, and divided them by their ethnicity. Oppressing one group of them by killing their sons whilst keeping their women alive, he oppressed others.

5.Musharraf Hussain: Our plan was to favour the victims in the land and to make them leaders and heirs;

6.Musharraf Hussain: to settle them in the land and, through them, to force Pharaoh, Haman and their armies to face their worst fears

7.Musharraf Hussain: We inspired the mother of Musa: “Breastfeed him, but when you fear for him then put him in a basket and let it float on the river, but don’t be afraid or sad. We shall return him to you and make him a messenger.

8.Musharraf Hussain: Members of Pharaoh’s household found him by chance, little did they know he would become their enemy and a cause of grief. Pharaoh, Haman and their armies were gravely mistaken.

9.Musharraf Hussain: Pharaoh’s wife said, “He would be a joy to behold for me and you, so don’t kill him he may be useful for us, or we could adopt him. They were unaware of its consequences.”

10.Musharraf Hussain: By the morning Musa’s mother was impatient and she nearly revealed his identity, if We hadn’t strengthened her resolve to remain silent about him.

11.Musharraf Hussain: She told his sister: “Follow him.” From the river bank she kept an eye on him without letting the Egyptians see her.

12.Musharraf Hussain: We made him reject the breast milk of the wet nurses, so his sister said to them, “Shall I show you a household that will look after him for you and take good care of him?”

13.Musharraf Hussain: So We returned him to his mother, to be a comforting sight for her sore eyes, so she wouldn’t be anxious and know that Allah’s promise is true. Though most people don’t know

14.Musharraf Hussain: When he had grown up and reached maturity, We blessed him with wisdom and knowledge; that’s how We reward the righteous.

15.Musharraf Hussain: One day, he entered the town while people were resting and found two men fighting, one from his ethnic group and the other from his enemy. The one from his ethnic group cried out to him for help against the one from his enemy’s group; so Musa punched him, so hard that it finished him off. Musa said, “This is the work of Satan. He is clearly an enemy who leads people astray.”

16.Musharraf Hussain: Then he said, “My Lord, I have done wrong, so forgive me.” Allah forgave him; the Forgiving, the Caring.

17.Musharraf Hussain: Musa said, “My Lord, because you gave me favours I will never stand up for criminals again.”

18.Musharraf Hussain: From then on he became fearful in the town, constantly on the lookout. Next day, the man who previously sought his help again cried out. Musa said, “You are clearly a deceitful man.”

19.Musharraf Hussain: Musa tried to grab the enemy and the Israelite said, “Musa, are you going to kill me like you killed someone yesterday? You want to be an oppressor in the land; you’ve no wish to do good.”

20.Musharraf Hussain: A man from the far side of town came running and said, “Musa, members of Pharaoh’s court are deliberating whether to have you killed, so leave now. I am your well-wisher.”

21.Musharraf Hussain: So he left the city in fear and remained wary, he prayed: “My Lord, save me from this nation of wrongdoers.”

22.Musharraf Hussain: Having set out for Madyan, he said to himself: “Maybe, My Lord will guide me on the right path.”

23.Musharraf Hussain: After he arrived at the water well of Madyan, he found a large crowd of people watering their flocks. He saw standing apart from them two women, holding their sheep back. He asked: “What is the matter with you?” They said, “We can’t water our sheep until the shepherds move off, our father is an elderly man, unable to help us.”

24.Musharraf Hussain: So Musa watered their sheep, then he turned to rest in the shade, praying: “My Lord, I am in desperate need of whatever good You may send down to me.

25.Musharraf Hussain: One of the two women came to him, walking shyly, and said, “My father is calling you, to reward you for watering our flock.” Musa went and told him the whole story. He said, “Do not be afraid. You have been saved from nation of wrongdoers.”

26.Musharraf Hussain: One of them said, “My dear father, why not employ him? The best person you can employ is strong and trustworthy.”

27.Musharraf Hussain: He said, “I wish to marry you to one of the two daughters of mine, on the condition that you work for me for eight years. If you complete ten years, that will be up to you. I won’t impose it on you. Allah willing, you will find me to be upright in my dealings.”

28.Musharraf Hussain: Musa said, “That’s agreed between you and me. Whichever of the two terms I fulfil, let there be no resentment towards me; and let Allah be a guarantor of what we decide.

29.Musharraf Hussain: Once Musa had completed his term in Madyan, he set off with his family to Egypt. On the way he noticed a fire burning by the side of the mountain, he told his wife, “Wait here for a while. I’ve noticed a fire. Maybe I’ll bring you some news from there or some embers from the fire so that you may warm yourselves.”

30.Musharraf Hussain: When he reached it, a voice called out from the tree on the right-hand side of the valley in that blessed spot: “Musa, it is I, Allah, the Lord of the worlds.

31.Musharraf Hussain: Throw down your shepherd’ s staff.” When he saw it wriggling like a snake, he turned and fled, without looking back. “Musa, go ahead and pick it up, and don’t be afraid. You are safe.

32.Musharraf Hussain: Put your hand inside your shirt, and it will come out brilliant white and unharmed, and hold it under the armpit to rid yourself of fear. Here are two proofs from your Lord to show to Pharaoh and his nobles; they are sinners.

33.Musharraf Hussain: Musa said, “My Lord, I killed one of their men, I fear they’ll kill me.

34.Musharraf Hussain: My brother, Harun, is more eloquent in speech than I am, so send him with me as a support to confirm what I say, for I fear they will reject me.”

35.Musharraf Hussain: Allah said, “We shall strengthen your arm with your brother and give you both authority, so that they don’t harm you; because of Our signs, the two of you and whoever follows you will be victorious.

36.Musharraf Hussain: When Musa came with Our clear signs to them, they said, “This is nothing but clever tricks of magic; and we never heard this message from our forefathers.”

37.Musharraf Hussain: Musa said, “My Lord knows best who comes from Him with His guidance and who will enjoy the Final Abode; but the wrongdoers won’t succeed.”

38.Musharraf Hussain: Pharaoh said, “My nobles, I know of no other god for you than myself. Haman, bake bricks of clay and build a tower for me, so that I may ascend to the God of Musa, though I know he’s a liar.”

39.Musharraf Hussain: And so it was that he and his armies, were falsely arrogant in the country, thinking they would never be returned to Us.

40.Musharraf Hussain: So We seized him and his armies and threw them into the sea. See the fate of the wrongdoers!

41.Musharraf Hussain: We made them foremost amongst those who call others to the Fire; and on Judgement Day, they will be helpless.

42.Musharraf Hussain: We tracked them with a curse in this world and, on Judgement Day, they will be the most despised

43.Musharraf Hussain: We gave Musa the Book, after We destroyed previous rebellious generations, to be examples for all people, a guidance and kindness, so they might pay heed.
