9.Musharraf Hussain: and driven out. Theirs is everlasting punishment.

10.Musharraf Hussain: The snatcher of information is chased by a fiery comet

11.Musharraf Hussain: Ask: “Are they more difficult to create than the rest of the creation?” We created them from a sticky clay.

12.Musharraf Hussain: Are you surprised they mock,

13.Musharraf Hussain: if they are reminded they take no notice;

14.Musharraf Hussain: when they see a sign they poke fun at it,

15.Musharraf Hussain: saying, “This is magic;

16.Musharraf Hussain: when we are dead and become dust and bones will we

17.Musharraf Hussain: be raised to life with our forefathers?”

18.Musharraf Hussain: Say: “Yes, and you will be despised!

19.Musharraf Hussain: It will be a single blast as they look on terrified.

20.Musharraf Hussain: With regret they will say, “This is Judgement Day.”

21.Musharraf Hussain: Indeed, the Day of Decision that you denied.

22.Musharraf Hussain: The angels will be ordered: “Gather the wicked people, including their spouses and whatever they worshipped

23.Musharraf Hussain: beside Allah, and lead them on the path to the Blazing Fire.

24.Musharraf Hussain: Stop them for questioning,

25.Musharraf Hussain: why are you not helping each other today?”

26.Musharraf Hussain: No, today is the Day that they submit fully.

27.Musharraf Hussain: They will confront each other, quarrelling.

28.Musharraf Hussain: “You overpowered us,”

29.Musharraf Hussain: they will reply, “No! You didn’t want to be believers;

30.Musharraf Hussain: we had no power over you, you were rebellious anyway.

31.Musharraf Hussain: Our Lord’s judgement against us is fair. We’ll taste the punishment.

32.Musharraf Hussain: We misguided you since we were misguided.”

33.Musharraf Hussain: That Day they will share the punishment;

34.Musharraf Hussain: that’s Our way of dealing with sinners.

35.Musharraf Hussain: The arrogant people, when they were asked to say: “There is no God but Allah,”

36.Musharraf Hussain: said, “Should we give up our gods for the sake of a mad poet?”

37.Musharraf Hussain: Nay, he came with the truth and confirmed the previous prophets.

38.Musharraf Hussain: Now taste the painful punishment.

39.Musharraf Hussain: You’ll be repaid fully for what you did

40.Musharraf Hussain: The sincere servants of Allah

41.Musharraf Hussain: will have plenty of provisions; fruits they were familiar with.

42.Musharraf Hussain: They shall be honoured

43.Musharraf Hussain: in Gardens of Delight,

44.Musharraf Hussain: sitting on comfortable sofas facing each other;

45.Musharraf Hussain: they shall be served drinks in cups filled from a flowing fountain,

46.Musharraf Hussain: white and delicious for the drinkers;

47.Musharraf Hussain: this wine won’t cause headache or confusion;

48.Musharraf Hussain: sitting with their spouses of modest gaze and lovely eyes;

49.Musharraf Hussain: like precious eggs, well-preserved

50.Musharraf Hussain: They will turn to one another asking questions;

51.Musharraf Hussain: one of them will ask, “I had a friend

52.Musharraf Hussain: who would ask me, ‘Do you really believe:

53.Musharraf Hussain: when we are dead and turned to dust and bones we shall be brought back for judgement?’

54.Musharraf Hussain: He will say, ‘Would you like to see him?’

55.Musharraf Hussain: So when he looked down, he saw him in the middle of the blazing Fire.

56.Musharraf Hussain: He said, ‘By Allah, you nearly ruined me;

57.Musharraf Hussain: hadn’t it been for the gift of my Lord, I would have been in Hell too.

58.Musharraf Hussain: Aren’t we to die except for our first death?

59.Musharraf Hussain: Shall we never suffer?’

60.Musharraf Hussain: This is a real victory.

61.Musharraf Hussain: Everyone should work for this

62.Musharraf Hussain: Is this better hospitality or the tree of Zaqqum?

63.Musharraf Hussain: We made this to chastise the wicked.

64.Musharraf Hussain: It is a tree that grows in the middle of Hell.

65.Musharraf Hussain: Its fruit is like the heads of Satan.

66.Musharraf Hussain: They will eat from it to fill their bellies,

67.Musharraf Hussain: then drink boiling water,

68.Musharraf Hussain: their home is Hell.

69.Musharraf Hussain: They found their forefathers misguided,

70.Musharraf Hussain: and thoughtlessly followed in their footsteps;

71.Musharraf Hussain: previously, most of them were misguided.

72.Musharraf Hussain: We sent many warners to them.

73.Musharraf Hussain: Look, what’s the fate of those who were warned;

74.Musharraf Hussain: only the sincere servants of Allah were saved

75.Musharraf Hussain: Remember when Nuh prayed to Us, so We responded graciously

76.Musharraf Hussain: and saved him and his followers from a terrible suffering.

77.Musharraf Hussain: We made his offspring continue in the world,

78.Musharraf Hussain: and we kept his praise in the future generations.

79.Musharraf Hussain: Peace be upon Nuh of all people.

80.Musharraf Hussain: This is how We reward the righteous.

81.Musharraf Hussain: He was our faithful servant.

82.Musharraf Hussain: The others We drowned

83.Musharraf Hussain: Ibrahim was from the same group;

84.Musharraf Hussain: he turned to his Lord with a heart free of evil.

85.Musharraf Hussain: He asked his father and people, “What do you worship

86.Musharraf Hussain: do you take false gods beside Allah?

87.Musharraf Hussain: What do you think about the Lord of the worlds?”

88.Musharraf Hussain: He looked at the stars

89.Musharraf Hussain: and said, “I’m sick.”

90.Musharraf Hussain: So people turned away and left him alone

91.Musharraf Hussain: So he quietly went to the temple full of idols and spoke with the idols: “Don’t you eat?

92.Musharraf Hussain: Why don’t you speak?”

93.Musharraf Hussain: He turned on them striking them with full force.

94.Musharraf Hussain: His people came to him hurriedly.

95.Musharraf Hussain: He said to them, “Why do you worship something you shape with your hands?

96.Musharraf Hussain: Allah created you and all you do.”

97.Musharraf Hussain: They decided: “Let’s make a pile of wood and throw him into a blazing fire.”

98.Musharraf Hussain: They plotted against him but We ruined their plot

99.Musharraf Hussain: He said, “I’m going to my Lord, He will guide me;

101.Musharraf Hussain: So We gave good news of a son with strong character.

102.Musharraf Hussain: When he was old enough to work with him, one day he told him: “My son, I saw in a dream I’m sacrificing you; tell me what you think?” He replied, “Father, do as you were told; you’ll find me patient, Allah willing.”

103.Musharraf Hussain: When both submitted and Ibrahim laid him face down,

105.Musharraf Hussain: you have fulfilled the dream. This is how We reward the righteous.”

106.Musharraf Hussain: It was a clear test of faith.

107.Musharraf Hussain: We saved Ismael in exchange for a slaughtered ram,

108.Musharraf Hussain: and left his tribute among future generations.

110.Musharraf Hussain: That’s how We reward the righteous,

112.Musharraf Hussain: We later gave him good news of Ishaq, a righteous Prophet.

113.Musharraf Hussain: We blessed him and Ishaq; some of their children were righteous, others wrongdoers

115.Musharraf Hussain: We rescued them and their people from a dreadful suffering,

116.Musharraf Hussain: and helped them to become the winners.

117.Musharraf Hussain: We gave them the Book that explained things clearly,

118.Musharraf Hussain: We guided them on the straight path,

119.Musharraf Hussain: and left their praise among the future generations.

120.Musharraf Hussain: Peace be on Musa and Harun.

121.Musharraf Hussain: That’s how We reward the righteous,

123.Musharraf Hussain: Ilyas was also from the messengers.

124.Musharraf Hussain: He said to his people: “Won’t you believe?

125.Musharraf Hussain: How can you worship Baal and turn your back on the best Creator?

126.Musharraf Hussain: Isn’t Allah Your Lord and Lord of your forefathers?”

127.Musharraf Hussain: But they denied and will be brought before Us,

128.Musharraf Hussain: except for the devout servants of Allah.

129.Musharraf Hussain: We left his praise among the later generations.

131.Musharraf Hussain: That’s how We reward the righteous,

134.Musharraf Hussain: We saved him and all his followers

135.Musharraf Hussain: except the old lady who remained behind.

137.Musharraf Hussain: Quraysh! You pass through their ruins in broad daylight,

138.Musharraf Hussain: and sometimes at night, don’t you understand

139.Musharraf Hussain: Yunus was also from the messengers.

140.Musharraf Hussain: When he fled on board the heavily-loaded ship,

141.Musharraf Hussain: they cast lots, he was the loser, thrown overboard.

142.Musharraf Hussain: A whale swallowed him, as he blamed himself.

143.Musharraf Hussain: Had he not been among those who glorify Allah,

144.Musharraf Hussain: he would have stayed in its belly till the Day of Resurrection.

145.Musharraf Hussain: Eventually, We flung him out, sick, on to an empty shore.

146.Musharraf Hussain: We caused a gourd tree to grow over to shade him,

147.Musharraf Hussain: and sent him back to one hundred thousand or more people.

148.Musharraf Hussain: They believed, so We allowed them to enjoy their lives fully.

149.Musharraf Hussain: So ask the disbelievers: “You assign daughters for your Lord and sons for yourself?

150.Musharraf Hussain: Were you witness when We created the angels?”

151.Musharraf Hussain: Beware! This is another of their concocted lies, they say,

153.Musharraf Hussain: Did He choose daughters over sons?

154.Musharraf Hussain: What has come over you that you judge in this way?

157.Musharraf Hussain: Bring your book if you are truthful.

158.Musharraf Hussain: They declare a relationship between Him and the jinn, and the jinn know they will be brought before him.

159.Musharraf Hussain: Glory be to Allah, He is far above what they imagine.

160.Musharraf Hussain: The true servants of Allah don’t do such things.

161.Musharraf Hussain: Neither you nor what you worship

162.Musharraf Hussain: can tempt anyone away from Allah

163.Musharraf Hussain: except him who will burn in the Blazing Fire

164.Musharraf Hussain: The angels will say, “each one of us has a role;

168.Musharraf Hussain: “If we had the Scripture like the past people,

169.Musharraf Hussain: we would have been like the devout servants of Allah.”

170.Musharraf Hussain: So they disbelieved the Quran; soon they will know

171.Musharraf Hussain: Our promise to the messengers, Our servants, was fulfilled;

173.Musharraf Hussain: and our armies were the winners.

174.Musharraf Hussain: So leave them for a while.

175.Musharraf Hussain: Watch them, they will see the reality soon.

176.Musharraf Hussain: Do they want our punishment to come sooner?

177.Musharraf Hussain: When it comes into their courtyards it will be a terrible morning for those warned.

179.Musharraf Hussain: and watch, soon they will see the reality.

180.Musharraf Hussain: Glory be to Your Lord, Lord of Might and Power far above their claims.

181.Musharraf Hussain: And peace be on the Messengers

182.Musharraf Hussain: and all praises are for Allah, Lord of the worlds

1.Musharraf Hussain: Sad. By the Quran full of reminders,

2.Musharraf Hussain: the disbelievers are haughty and hostile.

3.Musharraf Hussain: How many generations We destroyed before them? They all cried out for help, but there was no time to escape.

4.Musharraf Hussain: They are surprised that a warner came from them, they say, “This is a fraudulent magician.

5.Musharraf Hussain: He’s turned all the gods into one god? How strange!”

6.Musharraf Hussain: Their leaders hastily set out to tell people, “Walk away and stick to your gods. That’s what you must do,

7.Musharraf Hussain: we’ve not heard of this in any religion of recent times. This is a fabrication.

8.Musharraf Hussain: Did this reminder have to be sent down to him of all people?” So, they doubt My reminder? Then wait till they taste My punishment.

9.Musharraf Hussain: Do they hold the keys to the coffers of your Lord’s Compassion, the Almighty, the Giver?

10.Musharraf Hussain: Or do they have control over the Heavens, the Earth and whatever lies in between? So let them climb the ropes

11.Musharraf Hussain: The armies of the confederates that oppose you will be defeated.

12.Musharraf Hussain: Before them, the people of Nuh, Ad and Pharaoh of the columns, they all denied their prophets,

13.Musharraf Hussain: as did Thamud, the people of Lut and the forest dwellers. Those were the confederates of their day;

14.Musharraf Hussain: they denied the messengers and so My punishment was justified.

15.Musharraf Hussain: And the Makkans can expect a single Blast that will not be postponed.

16.Musharraf Hussain: Your opponents said: “Our Lord, give us our share in advance of either Heaven or Hell before the Day of Reckoning.”

17.Musharraf Hussain: Put up with what they say, and remember Our servant, the strong-handed Dawud: he was devout.

18.Musharraf Hussain: We made the mountains echo with him, glorifying Us in the evening and in the morning,

19.Musharraf Hussain: and the birds in flocks, each of them obedient to Dawud.

20.Musharraf Hussain: And so We strengthened his rule, and We gave him wisdom and the ability to reach decisive judgements

21.Musharraf Hussain: Has the report of the parties to a dispute reached you? They climbed over the wall of his private chamber

22.Musharraf Hussain: and came to Dawud, he was frightened to see them; they said, “Don’t be afraid. We have a dispute; one party has wronged the other. So, judge between us without deviating and guide us towards a fair solution.”

23.Musharraf Hussain: One of them said, “This brother of mine has ninety-nine sheep, whereas I have one. He demands: ‘Let me look after it,’ and he’s putting pressure on me.”

24.Musharraf Hussain: Dawud said, “He is wrong to ask for your sheep. Business partners often take advantage, one of the other – except the believers who are righteous, but they are few!” When Dawud realised We had tested him, he begged forgiveness of His Lord, fell in prostration and repented.

25.Musharraf Hussain: So We forgave him. Dawud will enjoy closeness to Us in the most beautiful of homecomings

26.Musharraf Hussain: “Dawud, We appointed you Our vice-regent on Earth, so judge fairly between people and don’t act on a whim that may lead you astray from the path of Allah. Those who wander away from the path of Allah will have severe punishment for neglecting the Day of Reckoning.

27.Musharraf Hussain: We didn’t create the Heavens and the Earth and what lies between them purposeless, though the disbelievers may think so. Woe to those who disbelieve, they will suffer in the Fire!

28.Musharraf Hussain: Should We put those who believe and do righteous deeds on a par with those who wreak havoc in the land, or those who are mindful of Allah on a par with outright sinners?

29.Musharraf Hussain: This is a Book that We sent down to you, a blessed Book, so people might think about its message, and the intelligent might pay attention.

30.Musharraf Hussain: We granted Dawud a son, Sulayman. What an excellent servant! Truly devout.

31.Musharraf Hussain: One evening, when the pure-bred horses were paraded before Sulayman,

32.Musharraf Hussain: he said, “my love of fine things increased my Lord’s remembrance. He watched them till they disappeared out of sight.

33.Musharraf Hussain: Bring the horses back to me.” He patted their legs and necks.

34.Musharraf Hussain: We tested Sulayman with an illness, so he became thin as a skeleton sat on his throne, then turned devoutly to Us.

35.Musharraf Hussain: He said, “My Lord, forgive me, and grant me a kingdom the like of which no one after me will ever see. Only You are the Giver.”

36.Musharraf Hussain: So We made the winds compliant to him, blowing gently at his command wherever he wanted them to go;

37.Musharraf Hussain: and demons from the jinn, their builders, divers;

38.Musharraf Hussain: and others bound in chains.

39.Musharraf Hussain: Allah said: “This is Our gift for you to give it to others or withhold it as you like.”

40.Musharraf Hussain: Sulayman will enjoy closeness to Us in the most beautiful of homecomings

41.Musharraf Hussain: Mention Our servant, Ayyub, he cried out to his Lord: “Satan has wreaked sorrow and torment on me.”

42.Musharraf Hussain: Allah said: “Stamp your foot on the ground. This is a cool place to wash and drink.”

43.Musharraf Hussain: We treated him kindly and cured him, so We gave him his family back and an equal number of others with them, as a reminder for those gifted with understanding.

44.Musharraf Hussain: Allah told him: “Take a handful of grass and strike your wife with it so you don’t break your oath.” We found him to be patient. What a wonderful servant! So devout

45.Musharraf Hussain: And mention Our servants Ibrahim, Ishaq and Yaqub; they were strong men with insight.

46.Musharraf Hussain: We chose them for the special task of reminding others of the Abode of the Hereafter.

47.Musharraf Hussain: In Our Sight, they are the best of the chosen ones.

48.Musharraf Hussain: And mention Ismail, al-Yasa and Dhu’l-Kifl; they were the chosen ones.

49.Musharraf Hussain: This is a brief reminder; and for those mindful of Allah, there will be a beautiful homecoming,

50.Musharraf Hussain: the Gardens of Eden with open gates waiting for them;

51.Musharraf Hussain: and reclining there on sofas, asking for fruits of all kind and for drinks,

52.Musharraf Hussain: and beside them spouses modest in their glances and of equal age.

53.Musharraf Hussain: This is what you are promised for the Day of Reckoning.

54.Musharraf Hussain: This provision of Ours will not end

55.Musharraf Hussain: This is for the righteous , the tyrants will have a most terrifying of homecomings,

56.Musharraf Hussain: Hell, where they will burn. What a dreadful resting place!

57.Musharraf Hussain: Let them taste, scalding water and pus,

58.Musharraf Hussain: coupled with other similar torments.

59.Musharraf Hussain: This here is another crowd rushing headlong with you into Hell. No welcome for them. They will burn in the Fire.

60.Musharraf Hussain: The newcomers will say, “No! It is you, there is no welcome for you, you got us in to this. What a dreadful place to stay!”

61.Musharraf Hussain: Then they will say, “Our Lord, whoever got us in to this, double his punishment in the Fire.”

62.Musharraf Hussain: And they will say, “What is happening to us? Why don’t we see those men whom we considered evil?

63.Musharraf Hussain: We took them as a laughing stock? Or did we overlook them?”

64.Musharraf Hussain: That is how the people of the Fire will quarrel among themselves.

65.Musharraf Hussain: Say, Messenger: “I am a warner; and there is no God but Allah, the One, the Supreme,

66.Musharraf Hussain: the Lord of the Heavens and the Earth, and whatever lies in between, the Almighty, the Forgiving.”

67.Musharraf Hussain: Say: “It’s news of great importance

68.Musharraf Hussain: which you reject.

69.Musharraf Hussain: I have never had knowledge of the assembly on high when a dispute arose among them.

70.Musharraf Hussain: The revelation to me is that I am a warner.”

71.Musharraf Hussain: Remember when your Lord said to the angels, “I am creating a human being from clay.

72.Musharraf Hussain: So once I have formed him and blown My spirit into him, prostrate before him.”

73.Musharraf Hussain: So the angels prostrated all together

74.Musharraf Hussain: except Iblis; he was arrogant and ungrateful.

75.Musharraf Hussain: Allah said, “Iblis, what stopped you from prostrating to the one I created with My Hands? Were you arrogant then, or were you already from the haughty?”

76.Musharraf Hussain: Iblis said, “I am better than him. You created me from fire, and You created him from clay.”

77.Musharraf Hussain: Allah said, “Get out of here! You are an outlaw.

78.Musharraf Hussain: My curse will be on you till Judgement Day.

79.Musharraf Hussain: Iblis said, “My Lord, give me time till the day they’re resurrected.”

80.Musharraf Hussain: Allah said, “You have it

81.Musharraf Hussain: until the Day of the Appointed Hour.”

82.Musharraf Hussain: Iblis said, “I swear by Your Might, I will try to mislead them,

83.Musharraf Hussain: except the devout servants of Yours.”

84.Musharraf Hussain: Allah said, “That’s right; and I too speak the truth:

85.Musharraf Hussain: I will fill Hell with you, Iblis, and those who follow you.”

86.Musharraf Hussain: Say messenger: “I don’t ask you for any reward for this, nor am I claiming what I’m not.

87.Musharraf Hussain: This is a reminder for all people;

88.Musharraf Hussain: and in due course you will know its truth.”In the name of Allah, the Kind and Caring.

1.Musharraf Hussain: This Book is revealed by Allah, the Almighty, the Wise.

2.Musharraf Hussain: We revealed to you the Book of the Truth, so worship Allah sincerely with commitment.

3.Musharraf Hussain: Take heed! Sincere commitment should be for Allah alone. People who take protectors beside Him, claiming that we just worship them to achieve nearness to Allah, Allah will judge their disagreement. Allah will not guide the lying thankless person.

4.Musharraf Hussain: Had Allah wanted to take a son, He would have chosen from His creation as He pleased, glory be to Him. He is Allah, the One, the Dominant.

5.Musharraf Hussain: He created the Heavens and the Earth for a purpose; He merges the night into the day and the day into the night; and made the sun and the moon for a specific task, each floating in its orbit of a fixed time. Indeed, He is the Almighty, the Forgiving.

6.Musharraf Hussain: He created you from a single being, then made from it its spouse, and gave you eight pairs of livestock. He creates you in the wombs of your mothers, developing stage by stage inside three layers of darkness. That is Allah your Lord, the Absolute Controller; He is the only God so how can you turn away from Him?

7.Musharraf Hussain: If you are unthankful, then Allah has no need of you; He’s not pleased with the unthankfulness of His servants. If you are thankful, He will be pleased with you. No one will carry the burden of another person, then to your Lord you will be returned and He shall tell you what you did. He knows your innermost thoughts

8.Musharraf Hussain: When a person suffers a hardship he calls His Lord devoutly, then when He eases the suffering he forgets that a short while before he had prayed to Him, and he sets up rivals with Allah which misguide him from His path. Say: “Enjoy your thanklessness for a while; you are people of the Fire.”

9.Musharraf Hussain: Can such a person be compared to the obedient, prostrating and standing during the night, fearful of the Hereafter and hopeful of his Lord’s kindness? Say: “Can those who know be equal to those who don’t know? Only the understanding people pay attention.

10.Musharraf Hussain: Say: “My believing servants, be mindful of Your Lord.” Those who are righteous in this life will have goodness. Allah’s Earth is vast; He shall fully reward the patient without limits.

11.Musharraf Hussain: Say: “I have been commanded to worship Allah, sincerely committed to His religion,

12.Musharraf Hussain: and I was ordered to be the first to submit.”

13.Musharraf Hussain: Say: “If I disobey my Lord, I fear the punishment of a Great Day.”

14.Musharraf Hussain: Say: “I worship Allah sincerely committing myself to Him,

15.Musharraf Hussain: so worship whoever you please beside Him.” Say: “The losers are those who lose themselves and their families on Judgement Day. That is a big loss!”

16.Musharraf Hussain: Smoke of fire above and smoke beneath them; with that Allah frightens His servants, so My sincere servants, be fearful of Me.

17.Musharraf Hussain: Good news for those who avoid serving the idols and turn genuinely to Allah, so give My servants good news:

18.Musharraf Hussain: those who listen attentively to what is said and follow the best of it, Allah has guided these, the one’s with understanding.

19.Musharraf Hussain: The one who Allah has passed sentence against, how can you rescue him? He’s already in the Fire.

20.Musharraf Hussain: But those who fear their Lord, they will have lofty apartments luxuriously furnished and streams flowing beneath them; this is Allah’s promise. Allah doesn’t break His promise

21.Musharraf Hussain: Don’t you see that Allah sends rain from the sky. He lets it seep into the ground, where it forms springs. Then with it He produces plants of different colours, then they become dry, so you see them turn yellow, and then He turns it back into soil. In this are lessons for the understanding people.

22.Musharraf Hussain: So the one whose mind Allah opens with the light of Islam will have light from His Lord. But those whose minds are closed to the remembrance of Allah will be ruined; they are wholly misguided

23.Musharraf Hussain: Allah has sent down a beautiful set of teachings in a Book that is consistent, proclaiming promises and warnings. The skin shivers of those who fear their Lord. Then, their skin and hearts relax with the remembrance of Allah; that is Allah’s guidance. He guides with it who He pleases. Whoever Allah allows to go astray, will have no guide.

24.Musharraf Hussain: So the one who must shield his face from the terrible punishment of Judgement Day, the evil, will be told: “Taste what you have earned.”

25.Musharraf Hussain: Others before them also disbelieved, and they were unaware of where the punishment came from.

26.Musharraf Hussain: So Allah made them taste humiliation in this worldly life, and the punishment of the Hereafter is even greater. If only they knew

27.Musharraf Hussain: In this Majestic Quran, We give examples for people of all kinds so they pay attention,

28.Musharraf Hussain: to an Arabic Quran, free from any defect so they may be mindful of Allah.

29.Musharraf Hussain: Allah gives this example: can a servant devoted to many masters who are at odds with each other be the same as the one who is devoted to only one master? All the praises belong to Allah! Unfortunately, majority don’t know

30.Musharraf Hussain: You shall die, so shall they die;

31.Musharraf Hussain: then on Judgement Day you will argue with one another, near Your Lord.

32.Musharraf Hussain: Who can be more wretched than the one who lied about Allah and denied the truth when it came to him? Isn’t Hell the final home of the disbelievers?

33.Musharraf Hussain: The one who came with the truth and the one who accepted him, such are the mindful people.

34.Musharraf Hussain: They shall have whatever they want from their Lord. That is the reward of the righteous.

35.Musharraf Hussain: Allah will remove their wrongs and give them an excellent reward for what they did.

36.Musharraf Hussain: Isn’t Allah enough for His servant? Yet they threaten you with idols they worship beside Allah; anyone Allah allows to go astray will have no guide.

37.Musharraf Hussain: And anyone Allah guides no one can misguide him, isn’t Allah the Almighty, the Avenger

38.Musharraf Hussain: If you ask them: “Who created the Heavens and the Earth?” They will say, “Allah”. Say: “What do you think about those you worship beside Allah; can they relieve my distress if Allah wished to harm me, or if He wished to be kind to me could they stop Him being Kind?” Say: “Allah is enough for me, those who trust put their trust in Him.”

39.Musharraf Hussain: Say: “My people, do what you want to do and so will I; soon you will know

40.Musharraf Hussain: who will be humiliated by sufferings in the world and finally thrown in an everlasting punishment.

41.Musharraf Hussain: We sent down the Book for people, it has the truth. Whoever follows its guidance will benefit himself, and whoever goes astray will fail himself. You aren’t their caretaker.

42.Musharraf Hussain: Allah takes away the souls of people dying and the souls of the living during their sleep. He keeps hold of those whose time of death has come, but sends back others, so they will die at their fixed time. In this are lessons for thinkers

43.Musharraf Hussain: Have they chosen intermediaries beside Allah? Say: “Though they haven’t got power nor understanding?”

44.Musharraf Hussain: Say: “Allah has complete authority for intercession.” He controls the Heavens and the Earth, then to Him you shall be returned.

45.Musharraf Hussain: When Allah’s Oneness is declared, the disbelievers of the Hereafter hate it intensely, yet when their gods beside Allah are mentioned they are thrilled.

46.Musharraf Hussain: Say: “Allah, Creator of the Heavens and the Earth, Knower of the unseen and the seen worlds, You shall decide between Your servants about their differences.

47.Musharraf Hussain: If everything on Earth plus twice as much belonged to the wicked, they would happily offer it as a ransom against the terrible punishment of Judgement Day. Allah will show them what they couldn’t have imagined.

48.Musharraf Hussain: Their evil deeds will be disclosed, and their mocking will track them as punishment.

49.Musharraf Hussain: When people are distressed they call on Us, but when We give them Our gifts, they claim: “We’ve been given this because of our knowledge.” Nay, it is a test but most do not know this.

50.Musharraf Hussain: Those before them said the same. Their works will not save them that Day.

51.Musharraf Hussain: The evil of what they did will distress them; the sinners will suffer the distress because of their deeds, and they will not escape.

52.Musharraf Hussain: Don’t they know Allah provides plentifully to some and sparingly to others as He pleases. In that are lessons for the faithful

53.Musharraf Hussain: Say: “My servants who wronged themselves, don’t be hopeless of Allah’s Kindness; Allah forgives all the sins, He is the Forgiver, the Kind.”

54.Musharraf Hussain: Turn devoutly to your Lord, and submit to Him before the punishment overtakes you – then you shan’t be helped.

55.Musharraf Hussain: And follow the best teachings sent down to you by your Lord before the unexpected punishment overtakes you when you are unaware

56.Musharraf Hussain: and a soul will cry out: “Woe to me since I disobeyed Allah and mocked His revelations.”

57.Musharraf Hussain: Or he will say, “Had Allah guided me I would be among the pious,”

58.Musharraf Hussain: or when he sees the punishment he will say, “If I could live again I would be among the righteous.”

59.Musharraf Hussain: Nay, My signs came to you but you denied them; you were arrogant and among the disbelievers.

60.Musharraf Hussain: You will see on Judgement Day those who denied Allah, their faces darkened – isn’t Hell the final home for the arrogant?

61.Musharraf Hussain: And Allah will save the pious in a safe place where they won’t be harmed, nor will they worry

62.Musharraf Hussain: Allah is the Creator and Guardian of all things.

63.Musharraf Hussain: He has the keys to the Heavens and the Earth. Those who disbelieve in Allah’s revelations will be the losers.

64.Musharraf Hussain: Say: “Ignorant ones! Are you telling me to worship others beside Allah?”

65.Musharraf Hussain: It was revealed to you and those before you: if you commit idolatry all your deeds will come to nothing and you will be the losers.

66.Musharraf Hussain: Nay, worship Allah and be among the thankful ones.

67.Musharraf Hussain: They don’t understand Allah’s true greatness; on Judgement Day, the entire Earth will be in His grip and the Heavens will be rolled up by His command. Glory be to Him, He is exalted above what they associate with Him

68.Musharraf Hussain: When the Trumpet is blown, whoever is in the Heavens and the Earth will fall unconscious, except him whom Allah wills. Then when it is blown again they will stand up looking dazed.

69.Musharraf Hussain: The Earth will shine with the light of its Lord, the Book of Deeds will lay open, the prophets and other witnesses will be brought forward, judgement will be made, and they will not be wronged.

70.Musharraf Hussain: Every soul will be fully rewarded for what it did; Allah knows best what they did

71.Musharraf Hussain: Those who denied their Lord will be driven into Hell in crowds. When they reach it, the gates will be opened and the gatekeepers will ask them, “Didn’t messengers from among you come to recite your Lord’s verses and warn you of this Day’s meeting?” They will say, “Yes,” but the sentence of punishment will come to pass against the disbelievers.

72.Musharraf Hussain: It will be said, “Enter through the gates of Hell; remain in it forever.” What a miserable home for the arrogant

73.Musharraf Hussain: Those who were mindful of their Lord will be led into Paradise in crowds. When they reach there, its gates will be opened, and the gatekeepers will greet them: “Peace be on you, you were good so enter it and stay here forever.”

74.Musharraf Hussain: They will say, “All the praises are for Allah Who kept His promise for us, and gave us this place, we shall live in the Garden wherever we want.” What a wonderful reward for those who worked hard.

75.Musharraf Hussain: You will see the angels around the Divine Throne glorifying and praising their Lord. A just judgement will be passed between them and it will be said: “All the praises are for Allah, the Lord of the worlds.”<basmala>In the name of Allah, the Kind the Caring.</basmala

1.Musharraf Hussain: Ha Meem

2.Musharraf Hussain: This is a Revelation from Allah the Almighty, the Knower,

3.Musharraf Hussain: the Forgiver of sins, Acceptor of repentance, Severe in punishment and the Bestower of favours. There is no god but Him. To Him is the return.

4.Musharraf Hussain: Only the disbelievers argue about Allah’s revelations, so don’t be surprised by their toing and froing in the land for trade

5.Musharraf Hussain: The people of Nuh before them and other parties after them also denied; each community tried to defeat their messenger and disputed desperately to crush the Truth with falsehood. I punished them, so look what became of them!

6.Musharraf Hussain: Your Lord’s sentence against the disbelievers was carried out: “They are people of the Fire.

7.Musharraf Hussain: The angels who maintain the Divine Throne and those around it glorify and praise their Lord. They are faithful, and seek forgiveness for the believers; they pray: “Our Lord, all good happens because of Your Kindness and with Your Knowledge, so forgive those who repent, follow Your way and protect them from the punishment of Hell.

8.Musharraf Hussain: Our Lord, admit them into Everlasting Gardens, which You have promised them and anyone who reforms himself, including their forefathers, spouses and children. You are Almighty, the Wise.

9.Musharraf Hussain: Protect them from the consequences of evil; whoever You have protected from punishment that Day, You will be kind to them, and that’s the supreme victory.

10.Musharraf Hussain: The disbelievers will be told: “When you were invited to faith you disbelieved, Allah’s dislike of you was far greater than your dislike of yourselves this day.

11.Musharraf Hussain: They will say, “Our Lord, twice you put us to death and twice you gave life; we now confess our sins, so is there a way out?”

12.Musharraf Hussain: That is because when you were called to Allah you disbelieved but accepted idolatry, so today the decision is Allah’s, the Exalted, the Great.

13.Musharraf Hussain: He will show you His Signs, and sends provision down from the sky for you. But only the devout pay attention.

14.Musharraf Hussain: So serve Allah, sincerely serving His religion, though the disbelievers dislike it

15.Musharraf Hussain: High above all ranks is, the Lord of the mighty Throne. The Revelation is sent by His Command to His servants with whom He is pleased to warn people of the Day of Meeting.

16.Musharraf Hussain: The Day when they will come out and nothing of theirs will be hidden from Allah. “Whose is the absolute power and control today?” “Allah, the One, the Dominant.”

17.Musharraf Hussain: Today every soul will be rewarded for what it did; there will be no injustice today. Allah is quick in reckoning.

18.Musharraf Hussain: Warn them of a fast-approaching Day, when hearts will come up to the throats chokingly. The evildoers will have no friend or an intercessor who will be listened to.

19.Musharraf Hussain: Allah knows the cheaters and what the minds conceal.

20.Musharraf Hussain: Allah will judge justly, but those they served beside Allah will make no judgment at all; indeed Allah is the Hearing, the Seeing

21.Musharraf Hussain: Haven’t they travelled about in the land to see the fate of those before them? They were far stronger than them, and they left behind many remains on the land. So Allah punished them for their sins; no one can protect them from Allah.

22.Musharraf Hussain: That happened because messengers came to them with clear signs, and they disbelieved, so Allah punished them; He is Strong, severe in punishment

23.Musharraf Hussain: We sent Musa with Our signs and a mandate

24.Musharraf Hussain: to Pharaoh, Haman and Qarun. They called him, “a magician, a liar!”

25.Musharraf Hussain: He came to them with Our Truth, and they replied, “Kill the children of the believers with him and spare their women.” However, the disbelievers’ plot was bound to fail.

26.Musharraf Hussain: The Pharaoh said, “Leave me to kill Musa, and let him call upon His Lord; I fear he will change your religion or spread disorder in the land.”

27.Musharraf Hussain: Musa replied, “I seek protection from my Lord and your Lord from every haughty person who disbelieves the Day of Reckoning.

28.Musharraf Hussain: A believing man from Pharaoh’s family, who had kept his faith secret, said: “Are you going to kill a man because he says Allah is my Lord, and has come with clear signs from your Lord? If he is a liar then let it fall on his head, and if he is truthful then some of what he threatens you with will fall on you.” Allah does not guide the one who is a lying rebel.

29.Musharraf Hussain: He continued: “My people! Today you rule this land and have power, but who would help if Allah’s punishment came on us?” The Pharaoh replied, “I have told you what I believe, and I am guiding you to the right path.”

30.Musharraf Hussain: The believer answered, “I am fearful about your fate, it will be same as those people who opposed the messengers,

31.Musharraf Hussain: the fate of Nuh’s people, Ad, Thamud and those after them. Allah does not want injustice for human beings.

32.Musharraf Hussain: My people, I fear for you the Day of Lament.

33.Musharraf Hussain: the Day you will turn back and flee with no one to defend you against Allah’s wrath. Whoever Allah lets go stray, will have no guide.

34.Musharraf Hussain: “Previously Yusuf came to you with clear signs, but you doubted what he brought until his death, then you said, “Now Allah will not send a messenger after him.” That is how Allah leaves in error the doubting rebel;

35.Musharraf Hussain: they dispute Allah’s revelations without His endorsement. That’s loathsome to Allah and the believers. So Allah closes the mind of every proud tyrant.

36.Musharraf Hussain: The Pharaoh said, “Haman, build a tower for me, so I might find pathways reaching

37.Musharraf Hussain: to the skies to look for the God of Musa; I think he is a liar.” That is how Pharaoh’s evil deeds appeared attractive to him, and he was prevented from reaching the path – and Pharaoh’s plot led him to ruin

38.Musharraf Hussain: The believer said: “My people, follow me and I shall guide you to the right path.

39.Musharraf Hussain: My people, the life of this world is a brief period of enjoyment whilst the Hereafter is the lasting home.

40.Musharraf Hussain: Whoever does evil will be punished proportionally, and whoever does righteousness, whether male or female, and is a believer will enter Paradise, there they will have unlimited provision.

41.Musharraf Hussain: My people, how come I am calling you to salvation and you are calling me to the Fire?

42.Musharraf Hussain: You invite me to disbelieve in Allah and associate with Him what I have no knowledge of. I will continue to invite you to the Almighty, the Forgiver.

43.Musharraf Hussain: Undoubtedly what you call me to worship is unfit for worship here and in the Hereafter. We will all be returning to Allah, and the rebels will be the companions of the Fire.

44.Musharraf Hussain: Then you will soon remember what I am saying to you; I rest my case with Allah. Allah sees His servants.”

45.Musharraf Hussain: Allah protected him from being harmed, but Pharaoh’s people were overwhelmed by terrible sufferings

46.Musharraf Hussain: The Fire of Hell will be there all the time for them until Judgement Day, and the angels are told: “Enter Pharaoh’s people into the severest punishment.”

47.Musharraf Hussain: In the Fire they will quarrel with each other, and those who were oppressed will say to the arrogant leaders, “We were your followers, now save us from burning in the fire.”

48.Musharraf Hussain: The arrogant will say, “We are all in it together; indeed Allah has decided among His servants.”

49.Musharraf Hussain: Those in the Fire will say to the gatekeepers of Hell, “Ask your Lord to reduce our punishment at least for a day.”

50.Musharraf Hussain: They will say, “Didn’t your messengers come to you with clear signs?” They will answer, “Yes.” They will reply, “So call them! The prayers of the disbelievers are ineffective.”

51.Musharraf Hussain: We support Our Messengers and those who believe both in this life and on the Day when witnesses will stand up to testify –

52.Musharraf Hussain: the Day when no excuses will benefit the wrongdoers – and they will be cursed and given a dreadful home

53.Musharraf Hussain: We gave Musa the guidance and made the Israelites heirs of the Book,

54.Musharraf Hussain: a guidance and a reminder for the understanding.

55.Musharraf Hussain: So be patient, since Allah’s promise is true, seek forgiveness for the sins of your people, glorify and praise your Lord evening and morning.

56.Musharraf Hussain: Those who dispute the revelations of Allah without any authority given to them have only a desire for greatness in their hearts that they will never achieve. So seek Allah’s protection, He is Hearing, Seeing.

57.Musharraf Hussain: The creation of the Heavens and the Earth is far greater than the creation of humans, but most people don’t know.

58.Musharraf Hussain: The blind and the seeing are not the same; the righteous believers are not same as the wicked. How little you reflect

59.Musharraf Hussain: There is no doubt that the Final Hour will come, but most people don’t believe.

60.Musharraf Hussain: Your Lord said: “Call on me and I will answer you.” Those who are arrogant about worshipping Me will soon enter Hell disgraced.

61.Musharraf Hussain: Allah made the night for you to rest in and the day for you to see His bounties; Allah is graciously generous to people, but most people are unthankful.

62.Musharraf Hussain: That is Allah your Lord, Creator of everything; there is no god but Him! So how then can you turn away from Him?

63.Musharraf Hussain: But that is how those who dispute Allah’s Scriptures turn away

64.Musharraf Hussain: Allah made the Earth for you to live on, and the sky a roof. He fashioned you in the best forms and gave you enjoyable provision. That is Allah your Lord! Blessed is Allah, the Lord of the worlds.

65.Musharraf Hussain: He is the Living; there is no god but Him, so worship Him sincerely, wholly committed. All praises are for Allah, the Lord of the worlds.

66.Musharraf Hussain: Say: “I am forbidden to worship those you pray to beside Allah, since clear signs have come to me from My Lord, and I have been commanded to submit to the Lord of the worlds.

67.Musharraf Hussain: He created you from dust, then from semen, then from a clot of blood and then He brought you out as a baby. Then you reached maturity, eventually becoming old – though some of you will die earlier – so you reach a fixed time so you might understand.

68.Musharraf Hussain: He gives life and death, and when He decides an affair He says to it: “Be,” and it comes into existence

69.Musharraf Hussain: Haven’t you seen those who dispute Allah’s revelations – how they turn away?

70.Musharraf Hussain: They don’t believe the Book that We sent with Our Messengers – they will know the consequences.

71.Musharraf Hussain: With iron collars around their necks and chains on their feet they will be dragged

72.Musharraf Hussain: into boiling water, then burned in the Fire.

73.Musharraf Hussain: They will be asked: “Where are those you associated with

74.Musharraf Hussain: beside Allah?” They will say, “They have deserted us, those we worshipped in the past were nothing.” That is how Allah lets the disbelievers go astray.

75.Musharraf Hussain: This is all because you were happy with falsehood in the Earth and lived merrily.

76.Musharraf Hussain: Enter through the gates of Hell to stay there forever, a terrible place for the arrogant.

77.Musharraf Hussain: So be patient; Allah’s promise is true. Whether We let you see some of the punishment promised to them or We cause you to die first it does not matter; finally, they will be returned to Us

78.Musharraf Hussain: We sent messengers before you; some We told you about and others We haven’t yet told you about. A messenger only brings miracles by Allah’s permission. When Allah’s command comes on Judgement Day justice will be done; there the followers of falsehood will be losers.

79.Musharraf Hussain: Allah made livestock for you to ride on and to eat from,

80.Musharraf Hussain: there are other benefits too for you in them. You can get to any destination you wish riding on them, and ships also carry you.

81.Musharraf Hussain: He shows you His signs, so which of Allah’s signs will you deny

82.Musharraf Hussain: Haven’t they travelled about the land and seen the outcome of the deniers of past times? They were greater in numbers, mightier than them and moreover left behind bigger remains on the land, yet all they accomplished will not benefit.

83.Musharraf Hussain: So when Our messengers came to them with clear signs, they smugly continued with what little they knew, and were finally engulfed by the punishment they mocked.

84.Musharraf Hussain: So when they saw Our punishment they declared, “We believe in Allah; the One and we reject any partner we associated with Him.”

85.Musharraf Hussain: Their belief won’t benefit them now, since they have seen Our punishment. This was the Way of Allah among His servants in the past, the disbelievers will be utter losers there

41.SurahEnglishNames: Explained in Detail, Revelations Well Expounded

1.Musharraf Hussain: Ha Meem.

2.Musharraf Hussain: This is a Revelation from the Kind, the Caring;

3.Musharraf Hussain: a Book whose verses are clearly explained, an Arabic Quran for people who know.

4.Musharraf Hussain: It gives good news and warnings, though most of them will turn away and won’t listen.

5.Musharraf Hussain: They say, “Our hearts are hardy to what you invite us to; we are hard of hearing and there is a barrier between us and you, therefore do as you like, and we shall do what we like.”

6.Musharraf Hussain: Say: “I am a human like you; except that I receive revelation: your Lord is One God, so take the straight path to Him and seek forgiveness. Woe to the idolaters.

7.Musharraf Hussain: Those who don’t give charity and deny the Hereafter.

8.Musharraf Hussain: But the believers who are righteous will have a never-ending reward.

9.Musharraf Hussain: Say: “Do you deny the one Who created the Earth in two days? You have set up rivals to the Lord of the worlds.”

10.Musharraf Hussain: He made the mountains, blessed it, and in four days determined its provisions for seekers.

11.Musharraf Hussain: Then He focused on the sky and it was smoke so He said to it and the Earth: “Come into existence whether willingly or unwillingly.” They replied, “We shall come willingly.”

12.Musharraf Hussain: In two days He formed them into seven skies, and to each sky He assigned its functions. We decorated the nearest sky with stars and made it safe. That’s the plan of the Almighty, the All-Knowing

13.Musharraf Hussain: If they turn away say: “I warned you of a thunderbolt like the thunderbolt of Ad and Thamud.”

14.Musharraf Hussain: When their messengers came to them from all sides saying, “Worship Allah alone,” they replied, “Had Our Lord so wanted He would have sent angels; we refuse to accept what you have been sent with.”

15.Musharraf Hussain: The people of Ad behaved arrogantly and unjustly on the land, and boasted, “Who is stronger than us?” Didn’t they realise Allah created them, He is stronger than them? But they still rejected Our messages.

16.Musharraf Hussain: So, over a few ill-fated days We sent a violent roaring wind to give them a taste of the shocking punishment in this life and an even more shameful one in the Hereafter, and they won’t be helped.

17.Musharraf Hussain: Similarly, We gave the people of Thamud guidance, but they preferred blindness instead of guidance, so they were struck by a thunderbolt of a shocking punishment for what they did.

18.Musharraf Hussain: But, We saved the obedient believers

19.Musharraf Hussain: The Day all enemies of Allah are gathered in Hell, they will be divided into groups, and

20.Musharraf Hussain: when they reach it, their ears, eyes and skins will testify against them for their misdeeds.

21.Musharraf Hussain: They will ask their skins, “Why did you testify against us?” They will reply, “Allah is the One Who taught everything to speak and has taught us to speak too, and He created you the first time and to Him you will be returned.”

22.Musharraf Hussain: You didn’t try to hide your evil deeds from your ears, your eyes and your skins. But you thought that Allah didn’t know what you did.

23.Musharraf Hussain: That’s what you imagined about your Lord and it ruined you, so you became losers.

24.Musharraf Hussain: Even if they are patient now, the Fire will be their home. No matter how much forgiveness they seek, they won’t be pardoned

25.Musharraf Hussain: We appointed companions for them that make things seem attractive for them everywhere. Sentence was passed against them, the jinns and people before them: “They will be the losers”.

26.Musharraf Hussain: The disbelievers shouted, “Don’t listen to this Quran; you can drown it out with noisy laughter so you would prevail.”

27.Musharraf Hussain: We shall give the disbelievers a taste of severe punishment and repay them for the worst deed they did.

28.Musharraf Hussain: A payback for the enemies of Allah: Hell, where they will be forever, a reward for rejecting Our messages!

29.Musharraf Hussain: The disbelievers will say, “Our Lord, show the jinn and humans who misguided us, so we may crush them under our feet to make them lowest of the low.

30.Musharraf Hussain: People who say, “Allah is Our Lord,” and are steadfast are visited and motivated by the angels: “Don’t fear nor be sad, be happy with the news of promised Paradise.

31.Musharraf Hussain: We are your friends in this life and the Hereafter, and you will have whatever your souls want in Paradise: every wish fulfilled.

32.Musharraf Hussain: A warm hospitality from the Forgiver, the Caring Lord.

33.Musharraf Hussain: Whose speech can be better than the one who calls to Allah and acts righteously and openly says: “I am a Muslim.”

34.Musharraf Hussain: Good and evil aren’t the same; counter evil with goodness, and if there was any enmity between you and the other, he will become a dearest friend.

35.Musharraf Hussain: Only the patient are like this; they are fortunate.

36.Musharraf Hussain: If Satan tempts you, seek Allah’s protection. He is the Listener, the Knower

37.Musharraf Hussain: The night and the day, the sun and the moon are among His signs. Don’t worship the sun or the moon; worship Allah their Creator, if you truly worship Him.

38.Musharraf Hussain: If they are arrogant about worshipping Allah, so what, there are many in His service who glorify Him day and night, they never get tired.

39.Musharraf Hussain: You will see among His signs a dry, barren land; when We send rain it swells and plants grow there – the One Who gives life to it will bring the dead to life. He has power over all things.

40.Musharraf Hussain: Those who reject Our verses aren’t hidden from Us. So how can the one thrown in the Fire be better than the one who comes safely through on Judgement Day? Do what you like; He sees what you do

41.Musharraf Hussain: Those who deny the Quran when it comes to them do not realise that it is a honourable book

42.Musharraf Hussain: that cannot be influenced by falsehood from any angle, a revelation from the Wise, the Praiseworthy.

43.Musharraf Hussain: Messenger, what is said to you was said to the messengers before you; Your Lord is the Forgiver and the Lord of a painful torment.

44.Musharraf Hussain: Had We written the Quran in a foreign language they would have complained: “If only its verses were made clear.” What, in a foreign language yet he is an Arab: “It is a guidance and a healing for those who believe, but those who don’t believe are hard of hearing and blind to it, as though they are being called from far away.”

45.Musharraf Hussain: We gave Musa the Book, but disagreement arose about it too. If Your Lord’s sentence had not been passed against them, their disagreements would have been settled. They are doubtful and distrustful

46.Musharraf Hussain: Whoever does good does so for himself, and whoever does evil harms himself. Your Lord is not unjust to His servants.

47.Musharraf Hussain: Allah alone has the knowledge of the Final Hour: no fruit comes out of its cover, neither a female conceives nor gives birth except with His knowledge. On that Day He will ask them: “Where are my partners?” They will say, “We declare before You we aren’t their witness.”

48.Musharraf Hussain: Those they worshipped before will have vanished, and they will know there is no escape

49.Musharraf Hussain: Man never tires of praying for good, but at times of difficulty he becomes hopeless and sad.

50.Musharraf Hussain: When We are kind to him after a misfortune he claims, “This is all my doing, and I don’t think that the Final Hour will come, and even if I’m returned to my Lord I’m sure to receive Paradise from Him.”  We will tell them what they did and torment them with a severe punishment.

51.Musharraf Hussain: When We are gracious to a person he turns away and stays aloof, but at times of difficulty he prays and prays

52.Musharraf Hussain: Say: “Consider this: if this Quran is really from Allah and you deny it, who would be the biggest loser other than the one who opposed it openly?”

53.Musharraf Hussain: Soon We shall show them Our signs in the horizons and in themselves so the Truth becomes clear to them. Isn’t Your Lord enough, a witness over all things?

54.Musharraf Hussain: Beware! They are in doubt about meeting Their Lord. Beware! Everything is in His grasp.<basmala>In the name of Allah, the Kind the Caring.</basmala

1.Musharraf Hussain: Ha Meem,

2.Musharraf Hussain: Ain Seen Qaaf.

3.Musharraf Hussain: This is what Allah the Almighty, the Wise revealed to you, and those before you

4.Musharraf Hussain: Everything in the Heavens and the Earth belongs to Him; the Exalted, the Great.

5.Musharraf Hussain: The Heavens above nearly collapsed, the angels glorify and praise their Lord and seek forgiveness for those on Earth. Allah is the Forgiving, the Caring.

6.Musharraf Hussain: Those who have taken lords beside Allah know that He watches over them; you aren’t their keeper

7.Musharraf Hussain: We revealed an Arabic Quran, so you may warn the people of Makkah and its surroundings of the Day of Gathering, in which is no doubt; a group will be in the Garden and another group in the blazing Fire.

8.Musharraf Hussain: Had Allah wanted He would have made them one community, but He allows into His Care whom He pleases. The disobedient have no friend, no helper.

9.Musharraf Hussain: Have they taken lords or protectors beside Him? Allah is the only Lord, He gives life to the dead and controls all things.

10.Musharraf Hussain: Whatever you disagree about, the final decision will be Allah’s, that’s Allah, My Lord; I trust Him, and I turn to Him sincerely

11.Musharraf Hussain: Creator of the Heavens and the Earth. He made the pair of you, the human species, so you may multiply on Earth, and a pair of each livestock. Nothing is like Him and He is the Hearing and the Seeing.

12.Musharraf Hussain: The keys to the Heavens and the Earth belong to Him. He increases or decreases the provision as He pleases. He knows all things

13.Musharraf Hussain: He made the same religion for you as for Nuh; We revealed the same to Ibrahim, Musa and Isa, to accept this religion and not be divided. What you call them to, the idolaters dislike. Allah selects and guides to Himself anyone He wants.

14.Musharraf Hussain: The conflict among people, despite having knowledge, was caused by jealousy. Had your Lord’s sentence, that they will be given respite for a fixed term, not been passed, then the Judgment would have come sooner. Those who were made heirs of the Book, Jews and Christians, are in doubt and are making others doubt too.

15.Musharraf Hussain: Therefore, continue inviting people to the truth; remain steadfast as you have been commanded; do not follow their whims, but say: “I believe in what Allah has revealed from the Book; I have been commanded to be fair to you; Allah is our Lord and your Lord; our works are for us and yours for you; there is no argument between us and you; Allah will gather us all and we’ll return to Him.

16.Musharraf Hussain: Those who debate Allah’s being and attributes after He has been accepted, their arguments are meaningless in the sight of their Lord, upon them is wrath, and they shall have a severe punishment.

17.Musharraf Hussain: Allah sent down the Book with truth and scales of justice, and the Final Hour is near.

18.Musharraf Hussain: The disbelievers want to hasten its onset, and the believers are fearful of it, since they know it’s the truth. But those in doubt have gone far astray

19.Musharraf Hussain: Allah is most Caring to His servants, provides sustenance as He pleases, He is the Strong, the Almighty.

20.Musharraf Hussain: Those who want the harvest of the Hereafter, We shall increase its harvest for them, and those who want the harvest of this life, We shall give its harvest to them, but they won’t have a share in the Hereafter

21.Musharraf Hussain: Did their idols start a religion without Allah’s permission? Had the judgement not been passed, their fate would have long been sealed, and for the wrongdoers is a painful punishment.

22.Musharraf Hussain: You will see them in a state of terror because of what they did, as they face its consequences. But the believers who were righteous will be in the Gardens of Paradise, where their wishes will be fulfilled; they’ll have whatever they wish from their Lord. What a great bounty!

23.Musharraf Hussain: Allah gives this good news to His believing, righteous servants. Say: “I don’t ask you for any reward, except, ‘love one’s relatives’. And whoever does a good deed We shall increase its positive impact for him. Allah is Forgiving, Rewarding.

24.Musharraf Hussain: How dare they say, “He has invented a lie about Allah.” In that case Allah would have sealed your heart and blotted out the falsehood, and established the truth with His Words. He knows what’s in people’s minds.

25.Musharraf Hussain: He accepts the repentance of His servants, forgives evil deeds, knows what you are doing,

26.Musharraf Hussain: answers the righteous believers, and increases His bounty for them. But for the disbelievers there is a severe punishment

27.Musharraf Hussain: Were Allah to give all the people same amount of sustenance in the city, they would be indifferent to each other, but Allah gives it in right measure as He pleases; He is Aware and watching His servants.

28.Musharraf Hussain: He sends the rain when they lose hope, and spreads His kindness all around. He is the Helper, the Praiseworthy

29.Musharraf Hussain: Among His signs are the creation of the Heavens and the Earth, and the living things He has spread out. He will gather them together when He likes.

30.Musharraf Hussain: The misfortune you face is due to your own fault. However, Allah forgives much.

31.Musharraf Hussain: You can’t disrupt Allah’s plan on Earth; you have no protector and helper beside Him.

32.Musharraf Hussain: Among His signs are the ships sailing on open seas, appearing like mountains.

33.Musharraf Hussain: He could stop the wind blowing if He wished, so they would stand still on the surface of the sea. In that are signs for every patient and thankful person.

34.Musharraf Hussain: Or else He could wreck their ship, because of what they have done, but Allah forgives a lot.

35.Musharraf Hussain: Those who argue about Our message, let them know there’s no escape for them

36.Musharraf Hussain: What you are given is passing enjoyment of the worldly life, and what Allah has is lasting and excellent; it will be given to the believers who: trust their Lord;

37.Musharraf Hussain: avoid major sins of indecency; forgive readily when angered;

38.Musharraf Hussain: respond by obeying their Lord; perform the prayer; consult each other to settle their affairs; spend what We have provided them;

39.Musharraf Hussain: when oppressed they defend themselves.

40.Musharraf Hussain: A revenge against a wrong could turn into an equal evil, therefore <i>be careful and forgive and put things right through reconciliation; such a person will have his reward from Allah directly. Allah does not like the wrongdoers.

41.Musharraf Hussain: Anyone who defends himself against injustice mustn’t be blamed;

42.Musharraf Hussain: the blame is on those who commit injustice and oppress people in the city. For them will be a painful punishment.

43.Musharraf Hussain: Whoever is patient and forgives, now these are things one ought to do

44.Musharraf Hussain: Whoever Allah allows to go astray will have no helper after that, and you will see the wrongdoers when they see the punishment; they will say, “Is there any way of going back?”

45.Musharraf Hussain: And you will see them offered to Hell, overwhelmed and disgraced, looking around ashamedly, whilst the believers will say, “Today, on Judgement Day, the losers ruined themselves and their families.” Beware, the wrongdoers will have eternal punishment.

46.Musharraf Hussain: They will have no protectors beside Allah to help them, and whoever Allah allows to go astray will not find his way

47.Musharraf Hussain: Come back to your Lord before the Day when there will be no turning back from Allah. You will find nowhere to escape that Day, nor be able to deny your sins.

48.Musharraf Hussain: If they turn away from you Prophet! Know, We didn’t send you as their keeper; your responsibility is to deliver the Message. When We give people a taste of Our kindness they are joyful, but when times are difficult because of their fault they are ungrateful.

49.Musharraf Hussain: The Heavens and the Earth belong to Allah; He creates what He pleases, He gives daughters or sons as He pleases to whom He pleases,

50.Musharraf Hussain: to some He gives boys and girls and others He leaves childless as He pleases. He is the Knower, the Powerful

51.Musharraf Hussain: Allah doesn’t speak to any human being directly, except by revelation from behind a screen, or an angel brings the revelation by His permission. He is the Exalted, the Wise.

52.Musharraf Hussain: So, We revealed to you the Quran when you didn’t know the details of faith or the Scripture. We made it a light and We guide with it whom We please from among Our servants. And you are guiding them to a straight path,

53.Musharraf Hussain: the path of Allah – His is what is in the Heavens and the Earth – in the end, all things will return to Allah.<basmala>In the name of Allah, the Kind, the Caring</basmala

43.SurahEnglishNames: Ornaments of Gold, Luxury, The Embellishment

1.Musharraf Hussain: Ha Meem

2.Musharraf Hussain: By the Book whose teachings are clear,

3.Musharraf Hussain: We sent an Arabic Quran so you may understand.

4.Musharraf Hussain: Preserved in the Divine Tablet, securely with Us; it is majestic and full of wisdom.

5.Musharraf Hussain: Should We turn away and deprive you of this reminder because you are people who have gone beyond limits?

6.Musharraf Hussain: We sent many prophets to the past generations;

7.Musharraf Hussain: when a prophet came to them they mocked him,

8.Musharraf Hussain: so We destroyed them. They were stronger than them, and now they are part of history

9.Musharraf Hussain: If you ask them who created the Heavens and the Earth they will say they were created by the Almighty, the Knower,

10.Musharraf Hussain: Who made the Earth flat and in it made many paths so that you may find your way around.

11.Musharraf Hussain: He sent rain from the sky in carefully measured amounts; with it We bring dead land to life, similarly you will be brought out alive from graves.

12.Musharraf Hussain: He created all kinds of things, made ships and livestock for you to ride on,

13.Musharraf Hussain: sitting comfortably on their backs remembering the bounties of your Lord, and when you are mounted comfortably on them you should pray: “Glory to Him Who made this for our benefit; we weren’t capable of controlling it,

14.Musharraf Hussain: and we are returning to our Lord.

15.Musharraf Hussain: Do the idolaters think some of His servants are His offspring? Humans are openly unthankful.

16.Musharraf Hussain: So Allah chose daughters for Himself from His creation and preferred sons for you?

17.Musharraf Hussain: When one of them is given the good news of what he ascribes to the Most Kind, his face turns dark and he is furious:

18.Musharraf Hussain: “What!” One who is brought up in fine jewellery and incapable of presenting a case clearly.

19.Musharraf Hussain: They describe the angels who are servants of the Most Kind as females. Were they present at their creation? Their false claims are recorded and they will be questioned

20.Musharraf Hussain: They say, “If the Most Kind wanted, we wouldn’t have worshipped the idols.” They don’t understand what they are saying and guessing.

21.Musharraf Hussain: Or have We given them a book before this which they follow?

22.Musharraf Hussain: Nay; they say, “We found our forefathers on this path and we are guided by their footsteps.”

23.Musharraf Hussain: Similarly, when We sent a Warner before you to a town, the affluent people said, “We found our forefathers on this path and we are followers in their footsteps.”

24.Musharraf Hussain: The Prophet said, “If I bring you a better guide than what you received from your forefathers, even then?” They said, “We are deniers of your message.”

25.Musharraf Hussain: Consequently, We punished them; look what was the fate of the deniers

26.Musharraf Hussain: Remember when Ibrahim told his father and his people, “I reject what you worship

27.Musharraf Hussain: and I worship the One Who created me, and He guides me.”

28.Musharraf Hussain: And he implemented this word among his children so they may return to it.

29.Musharraf Hussain: I let them and their forefathers enjoy life, until the truth eventually came to them and a noble messenger who explained clearly.

30.Musharraf Hussain: When the truth came to them they said, “This is magic and so we deny it.”

31.Musharraf Hussain: And said, “Why was this Quran not sent down on a famous personality from one of the two towns?”

32.Musharraf Hussain: Are they distributing your Lord’s Kindness? We Ourselves distribute among them their livelihoods in this worldly life, and We raise some among others in ranks so some may take others in employment. Your Lord’s Kindness is more excellent than the treasures they gather.

33.Musharraf Hussain: And if it weren’t for the prospect that people would become one disbelieving community, We would have made for the deniers of the Most Kind, houses with silver roofs and stairways to climb;

34.Musharraf Hussain: the gates of their houses and the couches on which they rest would be made of silver,

35.Musharraf Hussain: and they would be surrounded by golden ornaments. These are mere enjoyments of worldly life. The delights of your Lord in the Hereafter are for the pious

36.Musharraf Hussain: Anyone who turns a blind eye to the Most Kind’s reminder, will have a Satan appointed as their close companion.

37.Musharraf Hussain: They will stop them from following the straight path but they will believe they are guided.

38.Musharraf Hussain: Until he comes to Us and says, “Woe! I wish we were poles apart” what an evil companion.

39.Musharraf Hussain: This criticism today will not benefit you at all since you have sinned and now you will share the punishment together.

40.Musharraf Hussain: Can you make the deaf hear or guide the blind? Or the misguided.

41.Musharraf Hussain: Even if We took you away We would certainly punish them,

42.Musharraf Hussain: or We shall show you the punishment We have promised them, and We can do so.

43.Musharraf Hussain: So, hold firmly what’s revealed to you, since you are on the straight path.

44.Musharraf Hussain: This Quran is a great honour for you and your people; you will be questioned about it.

45.Musharraf Hussain: And ask Our messengers We sent before you: did We ever allow gods beside Allah to be worshipped

46.Musharraf Hussain: We sent Musa with Our signs to Pharaoh and his nobles. Musa said, “I am a messenger from the Lord of the worlds”.

47.Musharraf Hussain: When he came to them with Our miracles they laughed at him.

48.Musharraf Hussain: Every miracle We showed them was greater than the previous one, and each time We punished them for rejecting it, hoping they might return.

49.Musharraf Hussain: And they kept saying, “Magician! Pray for us to your Lord through the contract you have with Him; we will certainly accept guidance.”

50.Musharraf Hussain: However, as soon as We removed the punishment from them, they broke the promise

51.Musharraf Hussain: The Pharaoh announced to his people: “My people, isn’t the kingdom of Egypt and the rivers flowing under my feet mine? Can’t you see?

52.Musharraf Hussain: Am I not better than this wretched person who can barely express himself?

53.Musharraf Hussain: Why hasn’t he been given golden bracelets? Why are there no angels sent down with him?”

54.Musharraf Hussain: So he fooled his people and they followed him. They were a sinful people.

55.Musharraf Hussain: Then when they roused Our anger, We punished them by drowning them all,

56.Musharraf Hussain: We made them a thing of the past and an example for those coming after them

57.Musharraf Hussain: Whenever the example of the son of Maryam is given, your people kick up a fuss about it

58.Musharraf Hussain: and say, “Are our gods better or him?” They say this just to annoy you; they really are a quarrelsome lot.

59.Musharraf Hussain: He was Our blessed servant who We made a model for the Israelites.

60.Musharraf Hussain: Had We wanted, We could have made angels on Earth to succeed you.

61.Musharraf Hussain: He is indeed a sign of the Final Hour, so don’t doubt it and follow me; this is the straight path,

62.Musharraf Hussain: let not the Satan stop you, since he is your open enemy.

63.Musharraf Hussain: When Isa came with clear signs he said, “I have come with wisdom to you and to clarify for you those things in which you differ, so be mindful of Allah and obey me;

64.Musharraf Hussain: indeed Allah is Mine and Your Lord, worship Him. This is the straight path.”

65.Musharraf Hussain: Then groups began bickering amongst themselves. So woe to the wrongdoers when they will suffer the punishment of a painful Day.

66.Musharraf Hussain: Are they waiting for the sudden coming of the Final Hour when they are unaware?

67.Musharraf Hussain: Even best friends on that Day will be each other’s enemies – but not the pious

68.Musharraf Hussain: My servants, today don’t fear nor worry.

69.Musharraf Hussain: Those who believed in our Scriptures and were true Muslims,

70.Musharraf Hussain: they will be told: “Enter the Garden; you and your spouses together happily.”

71.Musharraf Hussain: Food and drink in golden trays and cups shall be passed around. Everything that one desires and the eyes delight in will be there; here you will live forever.

72.Musharraf Hussain: This is the Garden you are made heirs of, a reward for your works.

73.Musharraf Hussain: Here you will have plenty of fruit to eat from

74.Musharraf Hussain: The wicked will be punished in Hell forever.

75.Musharraf Hussain: It will not be lightened for them, so they will lose all hope.

76.Musharraf Hussain: We didn’t wrong them, they wronged themselves.

77.Musharraf Hussain: “Angel,” they will call out, “If only your Lord would finish us off .” He will reply, “You are here to stay forever!”

78.Musharraf Hussain: We brought the truth to you, but most of you disliked the truth.

79.Musharraf Hussain: Yes, if they have made a final decision, let them know We have also made a final decision.

80.Musharraf Hussain: Or do they think We don’t hear their secret chats and private discussions? Nay, Our messengers standing by their sides are recording them.

81.Musharraf Hussain: Say: “If the most Kind had a son, I would be his first worshipper.

82.Musharraf Hussain: Glory be to the Lord of the Heavens and the Earth, the Lord of the Throne, from what they ascribe to Him.”

83.Musharraf Hussain: Leave them in idle talk and amusement until they meet their Day, which they have been promised.

84.Musharraf Hussain: He is the only God in the sky, and He is the only God on Earth, the Wise, the Knower.

85.Musharraf Hussain: Blessed is He to Whom the Heavens and the Earth belongs and all that is between them, and He knows the coming of the Final Hour and to Him you will be returned.

86.Musharraf Hussain: Those they worship beside Him have no right of intercession; only those who bear witness to the truth will have the right to intercession, and they know that.

87.Musharraf Hussain: If you ask them: “Who created them?” They will certainly say, “Allah,” so why are they deceived?

88.Musharraf Hussain: And I swear by what He says, “My Lord, these are a people who don’t believe.”

89.Musharraf Hussain: Prophet forgive them and say: “Peace,” they will come to know the reality

1.Musharraf Hussain: Ha Meem

2.Musharraf Hussain: By the clear readable book,

3.Musharraf Hussain: We revealed it on a blessed night and have been warning humanity.

4.Musharraf Hussain: In it every matter is decided wisely;

5.Musharraf Hussain: all the commands come from Ourselves, We send <i>Message and messengers, </i

6.Musharraf Hussain: a favour from Your Lord – the Hearer, the Knower,

7.Musharraf Hussain: the Lord of the Heavens and the Earth and what is between them – if only you are firm believers

8.Musharraf Hussain: There is no god but Him, He gives life and death, Your Lord and the Lord of your forefathers.

9.Musharraf Hussain: Unfortunately, they are in doubt, dilly-dallying.

10.Musharraf Hussain: So wait for a Day when the sky brings clouds of smoke

11.Musharraf Hussain: that will cover up people and they will cry: “This is painful punishment!

12.Musharraf Hussain: Our Lord, relieve us, and we will believe.”

13.Musharraf Hussain: They will not learn a lesson even when a Messenger has come to them,

14.Musharraf Hussain: they turn away from him and say, “He’s been taught by someone and is possessed!”

15.Musharraf Hussain: Shortly We shall remove the punishment, but they will turn back to their disbelief.

16.Musharraf Hussain: The Day We seize them brutally, We shall take full revenge

17.Musharraf Hussain: Long ago We tested Pharaoh’s people, when a noble messenger came saying to them,

18.Musharraf Hussain: “Hand over to me the servants of Allah; I am a trustworthy messenger sent to you.

19.Musharraf Hussain: Don’t regard yourself greater than Allah; I’ve come with distinct authority to you.

20.Musharraf Hussain: I’ve sought protection from my Lord and your Lord from your abuse;

21.Musharraf Hussain: if you don’t believe me then leave me alone.”

22.Musharraf Hussain: Musa called out to His Lord, “These are wicked people.”

23.Musharraf Hussain: So We ordered him: “Take my servants by night, though you will be chased,

24.Musharraf Hussain: after crossing the sea leave it parted, they will be a drowned army.”

25.Musharraf Hussain: They, the Pharaoh’s lot, left behind many gardens, springs,

26.Musharraf Hussain: cornfields and spacious homes and

27.Musharraf Hussain: clubs where they had fun.

28.Musharraf Hussain: We raised other people to inherit them,

29.Musharraf Hussain: neither the Heavens nor the Earth wept over them, they weren’t given respite

30.Musharraf Hussain: We delivered the Israelites from the shameful punishment

31.Musharraf Hussain: of the Pharaoh; he was arrogant and had gone beyond limits.

32.Musharraf Hussain: We knowingly favoured them above other people of their time.

33.Musharraf Hussain: We showed them many miracles; in them was a clear test

34.Musharraf Hussain: These Makkans say:

35.Musharraf Hussain: “There is only one death for us; we won’t be resurrected.

36.Musharraf Hussain: Why don’t you bring to life our forefathers if you are truthful.”

37.Musharraf Hussain: Are they better, or the people of Tubba and the people before them? We destroyed them since they were wicked.

38.Musharraf Hussain: We didn’t create the Heavens and the Earth and what is between them as an amusement park.

39.Musharraf Hussain: We created them for a purpose, but most don’t know.

40.Musharraf Hussain: The Day of Decision is the fixed time for all of them,

41.Musharraf Hussain: a Day when no friend will benefit a friend in the slightest, nor will they be helped,

42.Musharraf Hussain: except anyone Allah wants to be kind to. He is the Mighty, the Caring

43.Musharraf Hussain: The tree of Zaqqum

44.Musharraf Hussain: will be the sinners’ food,

45.Musharraf Hussain: like molten copper that boils in the stomach,

46.Musharraf Hussain: bubbling like boiling water.

47.Musharraf Hussain: It will be said: “Seize him and drag him to the middle of Hell!

48.Musharraf Hussain: Then pour the punishment of boiling water over his head.

49.Musharraf Hussain: Taste it! You were the honourable influential one!

50.Musharraf Hussain: This is what you doubted!

51.Musharraf Hussain: The pious will live in a safe place;

52.Musharraf Hussain: of gardens and water fountains,

53.Musharraf Hussain: wearing embroidered silken dress enjoying each other’s company.

54.Musharraf Hussain: That’s how it will be, We shall wed them with pure spouses with gorgeous eyes.

55.Musharraf Hussain: Safe and satisfied, they will enjoy every kind of fruit.

56.Musharraf Hussain: They will taste death only once and will be protected from the punishment of Hell,

57.Musharraf Hussain: a bounty from your Lord! That is the supreme victory.

58.Musharraf Hussain: We made the Quran easy to understand in your language, so they may pay attention.

59.Musharraf Hussain: So wait, they’re waiting too

1.Musharraf Hussain: Ha Meem
